boardgame.name: Blue J's Card Game
boardgame.description:
Blue J’s is a strategy game where the game grows into any shape as the cards are played out. Matching colors and/or symbols and placing them on the Start card is how the game begins. You force the other player(s) to draw cards based on how many complete squares you match. If you run out of cards you win the round or go for the quick win and match the Blue J’s. If you collect the most of nine Blue J’s Round Winner Tokens you win the game!

—description from the designer

listing.notes: Blue J’s is a strategy game where the game grows into any shape as the cards are played out. Matching colors and/or symbols and placing them on the Start card is how the game begins. You force the player to your left to draw cards based on how many complete squares you match. There are multiple ways to win. Match the Blue J's for an instant round win, block your opponent so they cannot play a card, run out of cards or have the least amount of cards in your hand at the end of the deck will win you the round. If you collect the most Blue J’s Round Winner Tokens you win the game!

boardgame.name: Dreams of Empire
boardgame.description:
Dreams of Empire is a competitive Deck-Building Area-Control game with Hidden Actions. Play as one of 6 Trusted Advisors to the Emperor as you try to sway the imperial council in your favor. However, the Empire is old and weak with new rumor's of revolt brought before the council each day. Without swift action the Empire will shatter. Prove to be the most Influential Advisor and the council will crown you the next Emperor! Can you make your Dreams of Empire come true?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Eagle Chase
boardgame.description:
In Eagle Chase, players move around the board with their die roll and with the actions on their cards visiting locations throughout the United States. Interesting geographical and historical facts are read out loud as players visit the destinations on their cards and when they catch up with the Eagle players earn a Star Token. Cards are worth one point and Star Tokens are worth two points. Be the player with the most points at the end of the game to win!

Learn interesting geographical and historical facts about some of the most well-known (and not so well-known) locations in the United States. Players travel the country, visiting as many locations as they can by playing their cards and rolling the dice, while also trying to catch up with the Eagle to earn extra points. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Euro-Game
boardgame.description:
White box with title and description "Across Europe by Game" in four languages.

The game wants to help open access to the future of Europe in a playful way. It wants to stimulate conversation and discussion, arouse curiosity, and the desire to deal more intensively with the EC member states. If the game succeeds in providing a little general education and understanding for the other EC member states and their inhabitants, then it has fulfilled its main purpose. As a supplement and to loosen up, some information about the global importance of B-Braun Melsungen AG is offered.

Contents: Game board, spinning top, dice, four game figures, 28 question cards with 254 questions and answers.

boardgame.name: The Long Hall
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

A mausoleum-temple, the complex is a site of pilgrimage and worship for those of the sect. The Hall's priests have always been somewhat mysterious, rarely seen coming or going, and their numbers are uncertain. Recently, something seems amiss at the temple, with priests not appearing to greet visitors, or perhaps visitors disappearing. A foul aura has fallen upon the place, and reports of giant insects prowling the area have increased...

boardgame.name: The Tomb of Spear and Smoke
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Paladin Nicholas Pascal died defeating the five sorcerer-princes. Years later, the tomb where the victor and vanquished are interred has been disturbed. Best to check things out, eh?

boardgame.name: HINT
boardgame.description: Draw, hum, talk, and mime your way through an all-new American edition of the hit European pop culture game.

boardgame.name: Redcoats & Rebels
boardgame.description:
Redcoats and Rebels-Élan for the American War of Independence is a collaborative work based on the recently released Élan Deluxe rules for 10-25 mm miniatures by Phillip Jones with special contributions from Messrs Mark Hume (AWI specific rules and army lists), Chris Johnson (more army lists) and Greg MacPherson (campaign rules).

Presented in a style similar to Élan Deluxe, (which was recently downloaded for the 10,000th time!), Redcoats and Rebels is well indexed and written in a straightforward clause style.

At nearly 100 pages including play charts, the zipped PDF file also has internal bookmarks for ease of navigation and includes campaign and optional rules, numerous specific unit and general ratings, battle scenarios and orders of battles for several actions in the AWI.

The game is scaled for 1:25, but can be used at the 1:10 to 1:50 ratio and uses any basing system.

The rules sequence features both simultaneous and alternate actions, resulting in an intuitive and balanced game that captures the feel of the period. Individual units represented are the battalion and regiment and players can do sub-unit actions such as company and squadron actions.

The complexity of the game is moderate, and would appeal to a player who enjoys small unit tactics and a wide latitude of unit options (within historical parameters) on the table.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Scion of Umeke
boardgame.description:
"A 2 hour Autumn and harvest themed adventure set in the Forgotten Realms for characters levels 3-4.
It is harvest time and the town of Pine Pass is making preparations for their annual Pumpkin Pagaent.

The celebration starts as visitors pack the streets of this otherwise sleepy hamlet, filling the town square market with revelers seeking all manner of autumnal delights. The highlight of the festivities is of course the spectacular array of fantastical, magically enhanced pumpkins grown by the workers of the Pine Pass Office of Pumpkin Affairs (PPOoPA).

But this year something has gone terribly wrong. It seems that an artifact from the Feywild, the Seed of Umeke, that was brought in to enhance the pumpkins also had a horrible side effect. The pumpkins were awakened by a the magics of the artifact and now seek out living creatures to drag back to their pumpkin patch to feed the plant that has sprouted from the Seed of Umeke.

Only a group of hearty adventurers can save the town from the ravaging horde of pumpkin creatures and their montrous master in this autumnal adventure."

(Authors' Summary)

boardgame.name: Adventure Maximum Core System
boardgame.description:
From website:

The role playing game system returns after twenty-seven year hiatus. First published in 1992, Adventure Maximum is a universal game system designed to amp up your enjoyment at the gaming table with exciting rules second to none. The new Core Rules is authored by the original designer Dennis McDonald who has over forty years of game mastering experience. The core system is packed full of rules for character creation, skills, multiple types of combat, weapons and equipment, magic, and psionics. This is the one book you need to take your gaming to the next level. What is even more amazing is that the whole system runs on a single D10! Play in any time era from primitive to far future. The Core Rules will teach you the basics to run exciting adventures to keep your players coming back for more.

boardgame.name: Schichtwechsel: Sol- & Thermalbad Expansion
boardgame.description:
The mini expansion introduces a second miner and another player action card into the Game.

Sol- & Thermalbad is an 2021 exclusive expansion from the "Herner Spielerzentrum".

MonsDRAWsity: Unusual Suspects features over 100 new monsters conjured up by Shut Up and Sit Down and illustrated by some of your favorite (or soon to be favorite) artists.

boardgame.name: Salvar Doñana
boardgame.description:
In Salvar Doñana, several environmental problems have emerged simultaneously in the Doñana National Park. The players are expert naturalists whose mission is to discover a solution for each of the four environmental problems before they get out of hand.

On each turn, the active player can use up to four actions to travel from one point to another, mitigate environmental problems, discover a solution, or build control centers. A deck of cards will provide players with these abilities, but they will have to be careful with the catastrophe cards, which will accelerate and intensify environmental problems. A second deck of cards will control the inevitable expansion of environmental problems within the National Park.

Assuming a unique role within the team, players must plan their strategy to combine the strengths of their specialties to conquer the solution to environmental problems. But if one or more of those problems extends beyond the point of no return or if too much time passes, all players will lose. If they find a solution to the four environmental problems in time, the players will win.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Being Mr Bean
boardgame.description:
"Goodness me. Doesn't time fly when you're enjoying yourself?"
- Mr Bean

Laugh out loud with this hilarious, storytelling party game where you get to get be Mr Bean!

Whether taking a leisurely stroll or making a holiday dinner, Mr Bean makes funny situations out of anything! Now it's your turn!

Lights, camera, ACTION! In Being Mr Bean, you set the scene!

Each round, one player acts as a Director and reveals a Scene card. The other players then take turns trying to explain, emote, or act out what happens next in an iconic moment from a Mr Bean comedy sketch... but watch out for the TWIST!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rumms: Schnipp die Krone
boardgame.description:
Snip for the kingdom! In an exciting duel for the crown, the blue kingdom competes against the red kingdom. Each team is supported by a strong troop. While knights and spies help the players attack, trolls and dragons defend their king around their own knight's castle.

Which formation is probably the best to defeat the enemy? Thanks to simple rules, players aged 7 and up get started right away. They flick and try to knock the opponent's cubes off the mat. The winner is the first player to flick the other team's king off the playing mat. A must for all dice fans!
The action-packed family game in the metal tin.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Schnippen fürs Königreich! In einem spannenden Zweikampf um die Krone tritt das blaue gegen das rote Königreich an. Dabei wird jedes Team von einer starken Truppe unterstützt. Während Ritter und Spione den Spielern beim Angriff helfen, verteidigen Trolle und Drachen ihren König rund um die eigene Ritterburg.

Welche Formation ist wohl die beste, um den Gegner zu besiegen? Dank einfacher Regeln legen Spieler ab 7 Jahren sofort los. Sie schnippen und versuchen, die gegnerischen Würfel von der Matte zu befördern. Gewonnen hat, wer den König des anderen Teams zuerst von der Spielmatte schnippt. Ein Muss für alle Würfel-Fans!
Das actionreiche Familienspiel in der Metalldose.

—description from the publisher (German)

boardgame.name: Superstars
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Jukebox Heroes!

When you are ready to unleash the unfettered power of rock to rule the holovids and inspire your adoring fans to make your name legendary, become a true superstar with over 15 new character options! As an Oracle of Song, you can unleash an Aria of Truth or an Overture of Thunderous Blows to achieve Harmonic Ascendance! As a subversive Vox Rider, you can hijack the streams and raise up the voices of the voiceless with sampling, spell reverb, and the struggle dialectic! Become the voice of liberation across the stars!

boardgame.name: Cursed Item Designer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

GM: You enter the abandoned mansion looking for the Lamp of Eons, the cursed item the town believes is causing the blight.

Player: What did the town say the lamp looked like?

GM: Hmmm.

Cursed items are a staple of any dark or horror campaign. But what form do these items take? A unique item design can spark the story of its tragic origin or just add color to your game. From a simple gold locket with a faded image inside to a stained wooden jewelry box with gleaming gold inlay, the item’s description can make it memorable. Healing Fireball Publications is here to help breathe life into these items with a collection of tables designed to allow a Game Master to create a cursed item with unique descriptors and qualities.

The tables in this product do not provide game statistics, instead, it is intended to work as inspiration for the game master. A bonus table is provided to generate a plain text description of the curse on the item for even more inspiration.

boardgame.name: Keepers of the Pale Flame
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Unravel a haunting mystery in this adventure for the world’s greatest roleplaying game!

For generations, the lighthouse at Weeping Point has protected ships from the dangerous coastal shoals. But three keepers in quick succession have been lost to strange misfortunes and no one now dares enter. Our heroes must unravel the bizarre mystery before more people perish...

Keepers of the Pale Flame is a 4- to 8-hour adventure for 1st- through 4th-level characters. It has been thoroughly playtested, requires minimal preparation to run, and can be easily used with any Fifth Edition campaign!

boardgame.name: Wicked Ones (Free Edition)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

WICKED ONES is a Forged in the Dark tabletop RPG about a group of fantasy monsters building a dungeon, launching raids on the surface to gather a hoard, and pursuing your nefarious master plan. Along the way, there's pillaging, rituals, concoctions, contraptions, discoveries deep in the ground, dungeon rooms, traps, creatures, minions, and so much more! You build your dungeon over time throughout the campaign and no two dungeons will ever be alike.

You bask in choosing the greater of two evils as your group strives to accomplish its master plan and terrorize the region around your dungeon. However, your vile deeds lure increasingly greedy and powerful adventurers into your dungeon. Can you stave off the inevitable onslaught of heroism that your notoriety brings?

You can get the full game for free. Try out building your own dungeon together with some friends or use the tools the game has to improve your other games! The full game includes:

● Forged in the Dark: Built on the framework made by John Harper for Blades in the Dark, with significant changes to better represent monstery gameplay.
● Build a Dungeon: Rules for building and drawing out a dungeon together, including traps, tricks, creatures, locks, minions, and things you discover underground.
● Cycle of Play: Four phases of play (lurking, calamity, raiding, and blowback) that set the pace of dungeon life.
● Dark Hearts, Dark Impulses, and Going Feral: Game mechanics that reinforce that you’re a monster.
● Flexible Spell System: Players choose a specific path of magic or god they worship, then flexibly create spells of different power levels on the fly.
● Powerful Ritual Magic: This extends magic further, allowing the creation of very powerful magical effects, though you must fulfill some special requirements and fight off those who might seek to stop your rituals.
● Monster Science: A robust crafting system to create whatever contraptions and alchemical concoctions you can imagine.
● Safety Tools: A write-up on recommended safety tools (X-Card, Movie Ratings, Lines & Veils) to help your group with sensitive subject matters.
● Nine Monster Playbooks: Play as several different types of monsters, each of which have a lot of room for making unique characters. Play as a Brute, Conniver, Crafter, Hunter, Marauder, Shadow, Shaman, Warlock, or Zealot.
● Five Dungeon Themes: Each theme has a unique core function and list of rooms that can only be built within that dungeon, allowing your dungeon to match your group’s preferred playstyle. Build an Enclave, Forge, Hideout, Stronghold, or Temple.
● Quiet Valley Sandbox Map: A regional map to give a place to build your dungeon within and rules to set up factions on that map cooperatively with all players at the table. This group worldbuilding fosters a great sense of co-authorship and buy-in from the players.
● Primal Ability: Choose any monstrous race and represent them by building their own unique abilities.
● Easy Start: A clear session 0 / session 1 starting scenario to get your dungeon up and running while teaching all players the game mechanics.

boardgame.name: Elector Counts
boardgame.description:
The old Emperor is dead, and his successor is anything but clear. In the halls of the powerful, diplomacy has failed, civil strife is rampant, and the trumpets of war ring loud and clear!

Fight for control of The Empire, securing your holdings with faith, steel, and gunpowder. Who among the Elector Counts is worthy of ascending to Sigmar’s throne?

An exciting new card game for 2-4 players, Elector Counts contains everything you need to vie for control of the Empire.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: War for the Overworld
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome back, Underlord! You do have the most impeccable timing. The wretched “goddess” Kira has finally misstepped and left herself vulnerable! Naturally, we must strike while the iron glows hot. Make ready, my old champion… There are souls to carve. - Mendechaus

This is a campaign guide for playing in the world of the War for the Overworld video game using the Wicked Ones tabletop roleplaying game rules. In this campaign, you'll take on the role of upper level minions serving an Underlord, building a dungeon, and fighting your way towards the surface.

Even for those who are not familiar with the War for the Overworld video game, this campaign guide has a lot to offer including new rules, a map. Also, as with Wicked Ones Deluxe Edition, all graphics in the book have been converted to high quality tokens and figures for VTT play and do-it-yourself printing. The campaign itself and the factions are well described within the book, which makes for great inspiration even without experience playing WFTO.

● A new sandbox map, Mount Desmos, with a detailed scenario focusing on underground raids before bursting forth into the Overworld.
● Underlords, powerful spirits from the Aether, leading your dungeon. They're a single character shared by the entire group and can cast spells and compel their minions towards action. Their abilities replace the core function of a dungeon.
● A dungeon core at the center of your dungeon. Located on the first level, it replaces the sanctum and second level of the dungeon. Defend it well, because if it falls, your Underlord is banished from the realm.
● Shrines and portals littering the Underworld, discovered while tunneling to the edges of the map to go on raids.
● 12 beasts from WFTO to serve your dungeon as creatures and a new way to bring them along on raids with you when necessary.
● 3 powerful titans that can be summoned by acquiring the Kenos artifact and finishing a tier 3 ritual. Each titan has its own unique bonus.
● 10 unit archetypes and new primal abilities to build WFTO-style PCs with.
● 15 heroes of the Empire, adventurers strongly connected to the factions within and around Mount Desmos.
● Active participation in dungeon defense by the PCs, who make a placement roll as an invasion occurs just like their minions do. Once you become aware of the invasion, you are free to move about the dungeon making invasions much more chaotic and dynamic.
● The Dungeoneer's Guide to the Underworld, an in-world field guide for the evil and good units in War for the Overworld written by Brightrock Games. This was previously available to those that bought the Underlord Edition of the game, but has been made available for inclusion with this supplement to give GMs and players way more background information on the denizens of Kairos.

boardgame.name: トリックバイキング (Trick Viking)
boardgame.description:
In トリックバイキング (Trick Viking), the players want to eat a "full course", but not overeat.

The game uses a deck of 50 cards, ranked 1 to 50, but with cards of 10 different suits. The winner of a trick will "eat" each of the dishes played. Instead of playing to a trick traditionally, a player can order more food - playing their card face down to the trick, but also adding a card from the undealt cards to their score pile.

At the end of a hand, players earn positive points if they have taken 10 or fewer cards, and 0 points if they've taken more than 10. However, if a player has taken 10 cards and there is exactly 1 of each suit, they immediately win; otherwise, the player with the most points over the course of 4 rounds wins.

boardgame.name: Panzerkampf: Armored Clash
boardgame.description:
The Russian Front witnessed the biggest tank battles in history. But for the crews of those vehicles, within each moment, each split second, there was only ever one target in their sights, or the one muzzle that remained unaccounted for.
Commander, loader, driver…they served in a cramped world, where the events of four bloody years became nothing but an endless succession of fights for a bridge, a village, or a way out.

This is Panzerkampf.

Panzerkampf pitches you into the fight via a short set of rules that have colour and detail where it matters. Your ace crew, veterans of many such engagements, may conquer all, live to fight another day, or be killed outright by that next unseen muzzle flash.
Protection, hitting power, speed, and crew experience are fundamental to the game. But no one survives without luck, representative of which are a number of random events that can help sway the balance one way or another. Engines stall; turrets jam; and from out of the sky come Stukas and Sturmoviks. Their cannon are deadly, but can they always tell friend from foe?
You fight on any flat surface, manoeuvring your force of realistic miniatures and making use of the battlefield terrain supplied with the package.
To get you started, the basic set of Panzerkampf offers 3 T34/41 tank models and 3 Panzer IVf1 models, as well as a supply of scenery.

—description from the publisher

Galactic Era: Ship Model Upgrade
boardgame.description: Alternate versions of the standard ship model of Galactic Era. Each of the 5 included colors has its own different ship type and gets 16 ships of that type. The 6th color, blue, is not included in the upgrade and keeps the standard model.

boardgame.name: Tome of Heroes: Character Options
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Broadsword's first expansion supplement, TOME OF HEROES: CHARACTER OPTIONS, an exciting booklet filled with new races, new classes, and additional options for existing races and classes.
boardgame.rpg: Broadsword: A Game of Legendary Heroes and Epic Adventure

boardgame.name: Cards for Solo or GM-Less Co-Op Play
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For players that wish to play Broadsword but don't have a group, or prefer solo play, or want to play as a group but without a GM, then this expansion bundle is for you!
boardgame.rpg: Broadsword: A Game of Legendary Heroes and Epic Adventure

boardgame.name: Broadsword Cards
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

As a play aid, physically holding cards in your hand is a wonderful way to increase immersion, develop better verisimulitude, and also keep track of what spells your magic user has, what special treasures you're holding, and more.

Inside this package, you will find over 200 cards:


120 Spell cards
40 Treasure cards
27 Skill cards
22 Artifact cards
boardgame.rpg: Broadsword: A Game of Legendary Heroes and Epic Adventure

boardgame.name: Broadsword Extras
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Inside this package, you will find:


Character sheet - all your information in one easy to read place.
Tokens - over 100 different tokens, including popular race/class combinations, monsters, notable NPCs, traps, and more. In both high quality print format and formatted for VTT use.
Cards - Includes decks for Treasure, Spells, Skills, and magical Artifacts you find along your adventures. In both high quality print format and formatted for VTT use. Players who want to include professionally printed decks can get just the cards here.
Dice - Broadsword uses Combat Dice, custom pictographic d6s for many of its actions. It also uses a standard d6 for certain other actions. In this package, you get a die template for at-home printing and assembly of the pictographic die, as well as individual die face images for VTT use.
Extras - Including overlays for some Quests, a printable setting map of the game world, a map for one complete Quest (printable and for VTT), and more.
boardgame.rpg: Broadsword: A Game of Legendary Heroes and Epic Adventure

boardgame.name: Firearms & Black Powder
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Firearms & Black Powder introduces optional rules for black powder weapons and handheld explosives akin to those found in the real world Renaissance. Included are rules for Pistols, Muskets, Grenades, and a new Class – the Handgunner!
boardgame.rpg: Broadsword: A Game of Legendary Heroes and Epic Adventure

boardgame.name: Tiles for Solo or GM-less Co-op Play
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For players that wish to play Broadsword but don't have a group, or prefer solo play, or want to play as a group but without a GM.
boardgame.rpg: Broadsword: A Game of Legendary Heroes and Epic Adventure

boardgame.name: Tome of Heroes: Spell Cards
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

For players Tome of Heroes: Character Options who want to have and use just the cards separately, this set of cards is for you!
boardgame.rpg: Broadsword: A Game of Legendary Heroes and Epic Adventure

boardgame.name: Conquering Despair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Quest Book, "Conquering Despair" - a campaign of 14 Quests structured in a "choose your own adventure" format, with branching paths and multple exits, where experiencing all the quests requires multiple playthroughs!
boardgame.rpg: Broadsword: A Game of Legendary Heroes and Epic Adventure

boardgame.name: Goblins in the Deep
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Quest Book, "Goblins in the Deep" - Delve into a goblin-infested cavern to find the cache of gold the goblins have been stealing from the quaint town of Deerwick. Expand your adventuring arsenal with the introduction of Body and Mind Checks. Improve your gaming immersion with a unique handout. And enjoy lots of verticality in this single Quest that spans across six different maps!
boardgame.rpg: Broadsword: A Game of Legendary Heroes and Epic Adventure

boardgame.name: Soultide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Quest Book, "Soultide" - A week ago, a group of rambunctious teenagers from the town of Hazelhelm snuck into the Forgotten Village on Barrow Hill and never came back. The search party sent after them also disappeared. Local legend claims they must have been devoured by the Lady of the Harvest for her ritual Soultide magic. Is the Lady of the Harvest real or just a myth? And can the Heroes find and save the villagers? Improve your gaming immersion with a unique handout. And enjoy lots of verticality in this single Quest that spans across six different maps!
boardgame.rpg: Broadsword: A Game of Legendary Heroes and Epic Adventure

boardgame.name: The Great Healer
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The concept of ghosts permeates every culture around the world; stories of chilling revenge, lost loves, and dark deeds echo like time capsules across history. Witnessing a sighting is rarely believed, with the existence of spirits being a hotbed of debate throughout the centuries.

Within The Great Healer, Investigators will witness phantoms of past and future events that surround the murder of a wayward cultist, Constance Battersay, as she tries to leave The Glutton Club, leading to a time loop from which those trapped within may never escape.

While investigating the sudden vanishing of a tourist in modern day Boston Harbour, the Investigators will be thrown into different eras. They will have to uncover a story of betrayal while navigating each time period to escape the looping paradox of Constance’s flawed spell, while they are unwittingly stalked by the ever-watchful Void Hunt who prey on those out of time

This scenario is intended for 2 - 5 Investigators and can take two to three sessions (8-12 hours) to complete.

boardgame.name: Nobody's Cards
boardgame.description:
Play the game by drawing a card and improve the quality of your relationships with your family or friends. Most of our cards offer a different game for various areas of life - e.g., habits, love, exercise or comfort zone.

Minimum of two players
At the beginning of the game, each person writes down 5 bad habits of his/her opponent. Players attempt to eliminate as many of their bad habits as possible in 7 days. On the last day, they summarize their results together, discussing each bad habit in turn. The winner is the player who eliminated the most bad habits.

boardgame.name: Underwater Campaigns
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Explore the wonder and danger of underwater campaigns.

boardgame.name: Black Rose Wars: Promo Forgotten Evocation
boardgame.description: To celebrate the return of the (Essen) convention after last year's stop, you will find Cthuly attached to the (Ashes) magazine! This "tender" mascot of the event, vaguely inspired by ancient and forgotten myths, is a new Promo Forgotten Evocation. Comes with his Forgotten Spell and Evocation card, and a fantastic resin miniature! Of course, Cthuly can also be used in both BRW and Rebirth!

boardgame.name: Pixie Dreams
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An intrepid pixie resolves to leave the safety of the mangrove trees and visit the town of Barangay. Convincing her mother is one thing but completing her Rite to Flight is another! Can the adventurers help begin her journey?

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

This adventure takes place in Maykanta, a Domain of Delight.
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-WBW Dungeoncraft, The Wild Beyond the Witchlight

boardgame.name: Black Rose Wars: Rebirth – The Rose Duel
boardgame.description: This is a never-released version of Black Rose Wars created by Ludus Magnus Studios. It is for 2 players and follows the basic rules of the original Black Rose Wars game with minor adjustments. It is a cut-out game contained within the Fourth edition of the LMS magazine called Ashes. It contains a folded board with a smaller Lodge that has 2 mage sheets printed near the edges. It comes with 1 new school of magic 'Agony' and 3 forgotten spells. There are no events or quest cards, instead those are printed on the game board and events are followed over the 3 turns of the game. The players control 2 new mages and can summon a new evocation called a succubus to inflict damage to others and pain upon themselves. This is a great way to introduce new players to the world of Black Rose Wars. Games are estimated at 30-60 minutes.

boardgame.name: Star Wars: Legion – Limited Edition Luke Skywalker Commander Expansion
boardgame.description:
Luke Skywalker fought on many fronts of the Galactic Civil War, battling the Empire both from the cockpit of his T-65 X-wing and on the ground with his lightsaber and trusty DL-44 blaster. Wherever the war effort took him, Skywalker was a symbol of hope to his fellow Rebels and soon Star Wars™: Legion players will get the chance to experience him like never before.

Fantasy Flight Games is happy to announce the Limited Edition Luke Skywalker Commander Expansion, available soon at your local retailer!

Ready for Action
Whether leading the fabled Rogue Squadron or a small strike team, Luke Skywalker earned his reputation as one of the Rebellion’s most enduring heroes through countless battles and this Limited Edition expansion depicts him as he appeared during one of the most iconic clashes in the Star Wars saga: the Battle of Hoth. Wearing his Rebel flight suit and perched atop the wreckage of his T-47 airspeeder, this version of Luke Skywalker is ready to continue the fight on the ground.

Not only does the miniature included here bring a totally new sculpt of Luke Skywalker to your Star Wars: Legion battles, you have the freedom to customize it to fit your personal taste. The miniature can be assembled carrying either Luke’s lightsaber or his DL-44 blaster and with or without his flight helmet. Additionally, if you decide to include the flight helmet, you can also choose whether Luke enters battle with its visor up or down.

However you decide to assemble your miniature, Luke Skywalker is as skilled as ever on the battlefield. This expansion also contains a unit card with abilities identical to the Hero of the Rebellion version of Luke Skywalker found in the Star Wars: Legion Core Set, but now featuring updated artwork matching his new appearance. Additionally, you’ll also find copies of Luke Skywalker’s command cards My Ally is the Force, Return of the Jedi, and Son of Skywalker featuring this updated artwork alongside the unit card. Finally, to ensure Luke Skywalker is fully prepared for battle, this expansion also contains reprints of four upgrade cards: Emergency Stims, Environmental Gear, Force Push, and Hope.

The Limited Edition Luke Skywalker Commander Expansion will only be available for a limited time. In the Unites States, this expansion will be available through local game stores, each of which will be eligible to receive a small amount. For those of you that live outside the United States, look for more information on distribution in your area soon!

listing.notes:
Game is completely new,
Shipping costs are not included.
We accept bank transfer

boardgame.name: The Haunting of Abbeyham Priory!: A Jumpstart for They Came From Beyond the Grave!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Abbeyham Priory is a gothic abbey of crumbling walls and dreadful history. Its inhabitants are terrible, its purpose is malign, and those intrepid adventurers who poke around in its ruined masonry may well unleash something utterly horrid on the world beyond.

You are the intrepid adventurers! And you are the only people who can contain the Haunting of Abbeyham Priory!

They Came from Beyond the Grave! is a dramatic, hammy, and horrifying tabletop roleplaying game of 1970s horror set across the 19th century and ‘70s era. This jumpstart provides you with all the tools you need to start a story of They Came from Beyond the Grave!, and tell many stories to follow.

They Came from Beyond the Grave! uses the Storypath System, provided in the pages of this book!

The Haunting of Abbeyham Priory includes:

Five playable characters — a Dupe, a Hunter, a Mystic, a Professor, and a Raconteur.
A story in three acts, perfect for a one-shot or convention play.
Creatures of the night to throw at your Players.
All the Cinematic powers, Quips, and Storypath system mechanics you need to run the game right from the page.
boardgame.rpg: They Came from Beyond the Grave!

boardgame.name: They Came From Dracula's Tomb!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dare you enter Dracula's Tomb?

This sourcebook for They Came from Beyond the Grave! is for every Director and Player who wants a story focused on the hunting of monsters, with Count Dracula as the central antagonist!

They Came from Dracula's Tomb! contains:

New rules for playing vampires in They Came from Beyond the Grave!
Gadgets and vehicles for incorporation into your stories.
New sets and example Enhancements and Complications for vampire hunting stories.
Comprehensive Director advice for running Beyond the Grave! games based around vampires and the hunt for Count Dracula.
boardgame.rpg: They Came from Beyond the Grave!

boardgame.name: Battletech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 11
boardgame.description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 11 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:


Ion Sparrow (Butcherbird) Prime/A/B/C/D
Kit Fox (Uller) T/G/J/K/R/V
Horned Owl (Peregrine) 1/2/3/6/7 “Shimafukuro”
Phoenix Hawk PXH-2K/3D/3K/3M/3S/4M/9/C/C 2
Gargoyle (Man O' War) T/F/I/J/K/P


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: ブブカ (Bubka)
boardgame.description:
In ブブカ (Bubka), seemingly named after famous Ukrainian pole vaulter, Sergey Bubka, the players are beginning pole vaulters who are bidding on a series of poles to use in their first competition.

Players will earn points for having a series of poles that are close in length at the end of the game. Each turn a pole is auctioned off, and the players have a limited set of chips to bid with, and will not receive change. Players also may not measure the pole on auction and must visually inspect it at a distance.

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Playmat #3
boardgame.description: Bring your Car Wars Sixth Edition arena to life – and take it off-road – with this 36" x 36" custom neoprene playmat!

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Playmat #2
boardgame.description:
Bring your Car Wars Sixth Edition arena to life – and take it off-road!

Includes one 36" x 36" custom neoprene playmat.

boardgame.name: Dreadful Meadows
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Dreadful Meadows - a land of tricks and treats, where creepy Confectionaires compete to be this season's sweetest supplier!

You play a kooky Confectioner, sowing and growing sinister seeds to create the most bountiful candy crops, through crafty field tile placement. As rounds progress, cultivating your candy crops allows for exciting expansion and experimentation! Conjure up a crew of magic Minions who can lend a hand with their abnormal abilities. As you prosper, summon your horrid Harvesters to intensify turnover, or utilize your crops to discover new Candy Concoctions.

Each game is unique through your choice of Confectioner and the strategies you utilize. Actions and seed varieties are limited, so your success in the meadow will rely on calculated decisions in the expansion of your fields, the concoctions you create, and how you utilize your Minions and Harvesters.

Will your Dreadful Meadow be an abomination, or this season's sweetest sensation?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lords of Vaala: Armies of Blood and Dreams
boardgame.description:
Increase immersion and table presence with these highly detailed miniatures (32mm scale) that replace the cardboard unit tokens from Lords of Vaala.

Cosmetic expansion of Lords of Vaala: Dragonbond which is also a standalone game with its own cards.

Learn more about the realms and peoples of Valerna with beautiful art in the lorebook.

boardgame.name: Lords of Vaala: Legends of Valerna
boardgame.description:
Bring in 4 new characters with their unique Vaala decks; 2 generals and 2 new roles featuring unique gameplay.

Haunt players with the Kadhah or play as the Fell Knight to forge temporal alliances with the highest bidder.

Extends the game to a maximum of 6 players
Duplicate player options with 4 new playable characters.

Enjoy 2 new modules: Draconic Offerings and Heroes of Valerna

In the Draconic Offerings module, the Dragons invade Valerna not only for raw power, they need to bring back offerings for their Azhurma —the Great Wyrms of Drakha.

Tokens are placed on the board during setup which the Dragons can hoard and spend to get benefits, or collect sets to claim Power tokens but Generals may attempt to find the dragons' lairs on the board to retrieve the tokens and collect Power by completing sets as well.


In Heroes of Valerna module has some Hero cards and whenever they are revealed, unique neutral champions are placed in a random uncontrolled region. These champions have a combat value of +2. Generals can attempt to defeat them and recruit them as captains for their armies. Dragons entering peacefully in regions with these heroes may become bonded, allowing them to move together, attack with +2 dice, and no longer be able to bond with Generals.

In a continent forged by war and raided by dragons, heroes can be found among the realms. There are no gods or destiny in Dragonbond. The decisions and actions of individuals is what shape this world, to start wars or to end them.

boardgame.name: Second-Hand Treasure
boardgame.description:
A One-Round Alternity Star*Drive Adventure

From the introduction:

A businesswoman, Sakura Uchuno, hires the characters to retrieve a stolen alien artifact. There are other three groups after the artifact, who steal it from each other during the PCs investigation. Lanco, a Sesheyan thief tied to the Aanghel criminal empire of Grith, but trying to disguise himself as a Void Corp Sesheyan commits the original theft. A group of pirates, the Red Lightning, find where Lanco hid the artifact, but quickly have it stolen from them by Kilikii, the T’sa explorer who originally found the artifact.

boardgame.name: Monstrous Manuorl: The Cursed Rune Toilet of Terrible Bad Make Danger!
boardgame.description:
A Book of Things for roleplayers, gamemasters and the curious

From the introduction:

Warning. The contents of this Monstrous Manuorl, The Cursed Rune Toilet of Terrible Bad Make Danger! contains very sharp words. Every effort has been made to dull the edges of these words with soft adverbs, gentle pronouns and fluffy indicatives, but some of the words remain very sharp and could cause a nasty nick if approached in the wrong way. Readers should exercise caution by reading the book out of the corner of their eye, always wearing safety goggles, and under no circumstances approaching a sharp word with the intention of nullifying its PH factor.

This warning is a warning brought to you by the makers of the Monstrous Manuorl, the letters T and E and the number 5.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep
boardgame.description:
Deep within the darkness of Ulgu, Realm of Shadows, lies an impossible maze sequestered far beneath the sea. Two warbands brave the twisting shadow-magics of this ancient place, one spurred by divine decree and the other by selfish rapacity. Success may mean escape and survival, but few return from Harrowdeep – the nightmare abyss where light itself withers and dies.

Enter the ultimate competitive miniatures game with the Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep Core Set. Inside, you'll find everything you need to start gaming below the waves of the Shadowsea, with miniatures, dice, cards, and more. Harrowdeep marks the beginning of season five of Warhammer Underworlds – a fast-paced, deck-based skirmish game set in the Mortal Realms. You can play right out of the box using the pre-built decks for the Rivals format – which is new to this season – or you can hone your deck using cards from the Warhammer Underworlds card pool for a strategic challenge.

—description from publisher

NOTE: The card back graphics in this set do not match those of all the previous games released in the Warhammer: Underworld series. You will not be able to mix and match cards from other previous sets with this one to deck build a unique team.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep – Illusory Might Rivals Deck
Warhammer Underworlds: Harrowdeep – The Exiled Dead

boardgame.name: Star Ocean: The Divine Force
boardgame.description: feature two heroe

boardgame.name: Mixology
boardgame.description:
Mixology is an approachable, cocktail-themed game, featuring a Modern artistic theme and focused on hand management.

On a turn a player can do one of three actions. 1) A Player can pick up a new recipe to add to the drinks they can play. 2) They can pick up ingredients or equipment needed to make the drinks. 3) Play a drink to earn points with the opportunity to earn bonus points based on customer preferences.

First player to 21 points wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Car Wars (Sixth Edition): Playmat #1
boardgame.description:
Bring Car Wars Sixth Edition to life with this 36" x 36" custom playmat depicting an asphalt combat arena!

Also includes:

Rule sheet
30 new cards (hazard, structure, accessory, & upgrade)

boardgame.name: Periodic: A Game of the Elements – Periodic Trendsetter
boardgame.description:
A single, bonus ability card for use with the game Periodic.

During setup, place this card next to the Goal Cards. Whenever a player activates a periodic trend 3 times in the same turn, they take this card (from the Goal Area or another player) and place it in front of them. The 3 activations may be different trends of the same trend, and may occur when Spending Energy or using a Bonus Tile.

The player who currently has this card gains a bonus ability. Whenever they move their Flask, they may move up to 3 additional spaces, following the movement rules of the periodic trend they activated.

Sold as a Board Game Geek Store exclusive.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Periodic: A Game of The Elements

boardgame.name: Periodic: A Game of the Elements – Low-Energy Efficiency
boardgame.description:
A single, bonus ability card for use with the game Periodic.

During setup, place this card next to the Goal Cards. Whenever a player Gains Energy from a trend with 0 and 1 Energy Tokens, they take this card (from the Goal Area or from another player) and place it in front of them.

The player who currently has this card gains a bonus ability. Whenever they Spend Energy for this turn, the second periodic trend activation only costs 1 Energy Token (instead of 2). Additional activations still cost 2 Energy.

This card is sold exclusively at the Board Game Geek Store.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Periodic: A Game of The Elements

boardgame.name: Puzzle Strike 2
boardgame.description:
The cast of Fantasy Strike has acquired magical gems which give power, but at what price? Those who hold too many gems are cursed forever. What’s worse, the ultimate gem to rule them all has been forged into a single, mighty scepter. Whoever holds it wields even more power at an even greater price.

In Puzzle Strike 2, players build their deck as they play, giving them the tools to arrange and manipulate their set of colored gems. These gems can be “crashed” (destroyed) in order to build up power for four different super moves as well as to flood other players with more gems. As this process unfolds, gems will fly back and forth between players as they desperately try to remain under the threshold of corruption. Holding the scepter “helps,” but can also doom the greedy.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Marriott International
boardgame.description:
Two of the most iconic and historic names have come together to show you why "90 never looked so good."

On this Marriott 90th Anniversary edition of MONOPOLY, you get the chance to buy, sell, and trade world-famous properties and brands like The Ritz Carlton, J.W. Marriott, St. Regis, Fairfield Inn & Suites, Aloft Hotels and many, many more while also wheeling and dealing with historic business endeavors like Hot Shoppes and In-Flite Services.

Build enough Rooms to make a Hotel on your properties, watch out for the Mini Bar Charges (and of course going to Jail) and collect as much Mr. Marriott Money as you possibly can.

Do you have what it takes to be the ultimate owner or will you check out early as your cash and construction disappear?

It’s all part of the fun as you celebrate being a part of the world’s favorite travel company!

boardgame.name: Rainforest City
boardgame.description:
In Rainforest City, players repopulate the Singaporean natural landscape by piecing together rainforests, mangroves and ocean terrain with native plants and animals to restore food chains.

Learn about biodiversity, ecosystems and the importance of conservation in this interactive strategy game designed for both families and board game enthusiasts alike!

With competitive, co-operative and solo modes of different difficulties, Rainforest City is a game that challenges as well as educates.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Crown Craft
boardgame.description:
Blacksmiths of Everland rejoice! The royal family of a prosperous kingdom has announced the new successor to the throne. To let the heir shine as bright as possible, the family has promissed a large reward for providing a unique crown. Forges from all over the nation are invited to join this competition. Gather your workers, mine beautiful gemstones and prove your craft skills. Whoever provides the most intriguing crown, is praised by the royals.

Crown Craft is a competitive game for up to 5 players, where every player tries to craft the most fantastic-looking crown. In order to do that they visit the mines, pick their desired gems, and socket them into the crown they have prepared. Gems are mined by rolling dice and pairing the results with the gem values to claim them. Most gems provide special effects, such as dice manipulation abilities and extra income, and of course, Victory Points.

Players may use those gems to complete their crown, to sell them or to gift them to the academy. The latter will in return provide magical tools so they can upgrade their forges! Present the most beautiful crown at the end of the game, and win the royal families favor!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Omega Red
boardgame.description:
The ultimate weapon comes to Marvel: Crisis Protocol! Once the Russian criminal Arkady Gregorivich Rossovich, Omega Red is the product of extensive and invasive experiments that transformed him into a dangerous weapon. Whether he is fighting the enemies of the Soviet Union, working for criminal masterminds, or killing to stay alive, Omega Red is a powerful and dangerous opponent. This expansion him and his carbonadium tendrils to Crisis Protocol. In additional to a beautifully detailed Omega Red miniature, this expansion also contains a stat card and three Team Tactics Cards, along with everything else players need to bring Omega Red to life on their tabletops.

~~~

Soviet-era experiments intending to create a super-soldier on par with Captain America resulted in the creation of Omega Red. Once the Russian criminal Arkady Gregorivich Rossovich, Omega Red is the product of extensive and invasive experiments that transformed him into a dangerous weapon.

The experiments implanted carbonadium tendrils into Omega Red’s body, an alloy almost as strong as adamantium, which act as his primary weapons. However, a side effect is that the radioactive carbonadium is slowly poisoning him. Omega Red must feed on the life force of others to temporarily preserve himself, which he does by wrapping his foes in his tendrils and feasting on their life force to sustain his own.

Whether he is fighting enemies, working for criminal masterminds, or killing to stay alive, Omega Red is a powerful and dangerous opponent.

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Jean Grey & Cassandra Nova
boardgame.description:
One of the first and most promising students of Xavier’s School for Gifted Youngsters, the mutant Jean Grey is gifted with the power of telepathy and telekinesis. She uses these powers as one of the founding members of the X-Men, a team of mutant heroes who protects a world that fears and hates them.

Cassandra Nova is the mummudrai of Charles Xavier, a parasitic being born to the astral plane. Her psychic entanglement with the powerful Xavier has given Nova incredible powers, including the ability to possess the bodies of others. As Charles’ dark reflection, she seeks to destroy everything he holds dear.

This pack brings both powerful characters to Marvel: Crisis Protocol with beautifully sculpted Jean Grey and Cassandra Nova miniatures. These new characters are two Team Tactic cards that unlock their full potential as well as everything else needed to include them in games of Crisis Protocol.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Eine-Seite-Rollenspiel
boardgame.description:
Eine-Seite-Rollenspiel (ESR) ist ein sehr kurzes, kostenloses und schnell erlerntes Rollenspielsystem für 2-5 Spieler*innen.

-1 Seite Regeln inklusive Probeabenteuer
-Bespielt damit jede Welt oder jedes Setting, dass ihr wollt.
-Schnelle Würfelproben drei möglichen Ausgängen
-Einfach zu leiten und einfach zu spielen.
-Optionale Regel mit Vor- und Nachteilen vorhanden

boardgame.name: Shekarestan: Bazaar
بازار شکرستان
boardgame.description:
Based on the famous Iranian Animated TV series, Shekarestan Bazaar is a worker placement and pick up and delivery board game set in the crowded bazaar of Shekarestan Land.

Players move from one spot to another, trying to buy goods with minimum price and sell in one of the grand bazaars with the highest possible price to win the King's favor for the best merchant of the town.

boardgame.name: Tartarus: Longo Itinere
boardgame.description:
Tartarus: Longo Itinere combines a Dungeon Crawler and a Card Game with PixelArt graphic.
Dive in the Underworld, where some heroes are invited by the Devil himself to test their abilities in exchange for their most deep desire.
Fight hordes of ruthless monster, choose your path wisely and use your abilities to get to the final boss and overcome the other heroes.

In the game each player chooses a hero, each with different features and abilities. Monster's and object's cards compose the covered field in which the players will have to move choosing the direction they see fit the most.
During the game they can use abilities both defensive and offensive towards the other players, but unlike other games Tartarus features a balance between the need to weaken the opponents and keeping them alive.

Mephisto himself can come into aid during the game but be careful since the Devil can be tricky! He gives you a chance but he eventually wants your soul and you'll need to focus on finding a way to overcome his last challenge!

boardgame.name: Shekarestan: Bazazi
بزازی شکرستان
boardgame.description:
Based on the famous Iranian Animated TV series, Shekarestan Bazazi is a game set in a bazazi (tailoring) shop in Shekarestan Land.
Players try to claim the customers and find a suitable fabric to gain coins and be the best tailor in town.

boardgame.name: Coup Rebellion G54: Anarchy Promos
boardgame.description: A small package containing one influence card of each new character featured in Coup Rebellion G54 - Anarchy.

boardgame.name: SlasHER
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

You emerge from the fog to find the east end of the village deserted and in ruin. On the wind, you hear a faint voice calling, "I will kill them all." You turn to leave, but mist obscures the way. There is no exit. Where is everyone? You have entered the domain of the SlasHER!

This was made for the Slasher Jam and is inspired by the unstoppable killer movies of the 1970s and 80s. This one-shot adventure features 24 pages of content including:

- An entirely likely TPK!
- - Beautiful artwork by Claude Monet!
- Barely acceptable artwork by Bracken MacLeod
- A Jump Scare table (play along, now!)
- A wicked awesome BBEG(al)
- Pursuit mechanics
- Blood
- More BLOOD!
- SO MUCH BLOOD!

boardgame.name: Hail the Rat God
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

She lives in the sewers below Grift.

She is served by the destitute and the broken.

She gives Her blessing only to the worthy.

boardgame.name: Durance of Death
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

This is a short adventure designed for characters of 4th to 6th level. Inside these six pages you will find a quick adventure hook and a dungeon to place into your own campaign world. This document includes:

3 new creatures
2 new magic items
1 dungeon map

boardgame.name: Race! Formula 90: Expansion #3
boardgame.description:
This is the third expansion module for Race! Formula 90 including


two new tracks on a double-sided game board: Magny-Cours and Suzuka. Both tracks feature unique characteristics and come with 62 fully illustrated Track cards.



the Official solo mode with increasing difficulty levels and special robot skills preserving all the thrill and extensive battling against Automa opponents.



52 fully illustrated car tiles featuring the suites of classic formula racing


—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Academic Society
boardgame.description:
In the 17th century, significant advancements were made in the field of science owing to the establishment of academic societies across Europe. As the leader of a faction within one such academic society, you must strive to earn prestige through your studies so that your faction can grow.
Myriad matters compete for your attention as you endeavor to maintain your influence in each of the sciences. Contributing to the kingdom’s growth by completing royal commissions, presenting your findings at conferences, and taking sabbaticals to gather knowledge in foreign lands are just a few of the tasks laid before you.
Will your quest for knowledge earn you prestige within your academic society and allow you to expand your faction?
c Society, you’ll compete to earn the most Prestige through the game’s three primary systems.

The first system involves the society board’s action spaces. Each round, you’ll place your scholars on various action spaces and perform the corresponding main actions.
Some action spaces allow you to perform a bonus action in addition to a main action; however, since there aren’t many of these special action spaces, you’ll have to anticipate what the other players will do and act accordingly.

The second system involves the management board’s influence track. At the end of the game, you’ll earn Prestige from the spaces occupied by your scholars on this track.
You can also choose to remove your scholars from the influence track and use them to perform actions starting from the next round.
Once removed, scholars cannot be returned to the influence track, forcing you to choose between earning extra Prestige at the end of the game or having more scholars on hand to perform actions with.

The third system involves the sabbatical tracks on your player board. Advancing your scholars along these tracks will earn you permanent bonuses.
However, scholars assigned to a sabbatical track stay there for the rest of the game, which means you’ll have fewer scholars available to perform actions.
Deciding if and when to assign your scholars to these tracks will require careful consideration.

As each of these systems involves your scholars, you’ll have to manage them wisely if you hope to emerge victorious.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: analog lunchbox (アナログランチボックス)

boardgame.name: Elder Tunnels (Issue 10 - Fall 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We have space horror as well as a graveyard romp. And how can you say no to a Monsters! Monsters! scenario called "Castle Van Hexxen"? Everything you need for your tabletop this Halloween and beyond. That is except your dice and imagination.

boardgame.name: Dreadful: Paranoia
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dreadful: Paranoia is a bundle of three unique games for Dread to give the most fuss-free, intense game night possible. Each game comes with everything you need to run it "out of the box" but they're also flexible enough to change in any way you can dream up.

Each Scenario includes:

Setting info
Plot synopsis
6 Character Roles + Easy-Print questionnaire sheets
Background Info
GM Section with additional info
3 Act plot outline that will guide you through a cohesive narrative


The bundle is 66 pages of aesthetically pleasing, easy-to-read layouts with full color artwork and embellishments and each campaign has its own unique identity, banking on different tropes found in a variety of horror media. Us and Them is a suburban horror designed to punish PCs who can't perform the strict roles of their social persona... a discovered body and an erased identity propell the PCs into a huge web of lies they never expected. Liminal Spaces is an abstract, psychological horror that traps the characters in a desert truck stop from where there is no escape. Their deepest fears and paranoias are at play here and worse still the truck stop itself seems to drag them out of reality by any means necessary. Watching Waiting will challenge players with a dangerous cryptid hunt that forces them to watch and observe instead of try to subdue it by force. Constantly torn between action and inaction, the PCs will need to plan out how to prevent civilian death and provide their shady government higher ups with plenty of information to react with a stronger strike force.

boardgame.name: Rooms with a View (Mythras)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Great locations are the lifeblood of great campaigns.
Rooms with a View gives you twelve unique locations that you can drop into any existing campaign, to use as springboards to dozens of adventures. Each location comes complete with colour maps, detailed NPCs, rich history, and interesting adventure hooks that stimulate your imagination.

Cross an ensorcelled bridge into an ancient land. Visit a very special inn, where the dead continue to watch over the patrons. Meet the caretaker of a dead god's final resting place. Watch a travelling show perform legendary stories. Wander through a ghostly city of otherworldly elves. And explore seven other locations that will keep your players coming back again and again.

Put the flavour back into role-playing with Rooms with a View. This 98-page supplement helps you create campaign memories that will last for years.

boardgame.name: Rooms with a View (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Great locations are the lifeblood of great campaigns.
Rooms with a View gives you twelve unique locations that you can drop into any existing campaign, to use as springboards to dozens of adventures. Each location comes complete with colour maps, detailed NPCs, rich history, and interesting adventure hooks that stimulate your imagination.

Cross an ensorcelled bridge into an ancient land. Visit a very special inn, where the dead continue to watch over the patrons. Meet the caretaker of a dead god's final resting place. Watch a travelling show perform legendary stories. Wander through a ghostly city of otherworldly elves. And explore seven other locations that will keep your players coming back again and again.

Put the flavour back into role-playing with Rooms with a View. This 98-page supplement helps you create campaign memories that will last for years.

boardgame.name: Betrayal at Shadewood Keep (Mythras)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

An adventure for The Design Mechanism's Mythras and Classic Fantasy books!

Raiding parties have been emerging from the dark Shadewood Forest to attack local villages.
The paladin responsible for protecting the area is unable to stem the tide of destruction. Can you protect the helpless villages while uncovering the mastermind behind the attacks?
Or will you fall prey to Betrayal at Shadewood Keep?

This 68-page adventure is designed for Classic Fantasy characters of Rank 3 and can be dropped into practically any existing campaign. This primarily wilderness-based adventure will give your druids and rangers a chance to shine, while still providing plenty of adventure for all character classes.

Betrayal at Shadewood Keep includes detailed descriptions of Kewin Town and Shadewood Keep, and all maps needed for play. Full monster and NPC statistics are provided, as well as two new gods—one good, one evil—that you can use to supplement your existing campaign pantheon.

boardgame.name: Foul Fey Fen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventures in Moldy Mabel Marshtooth's Mansion

A green hag has been terrorizing a small village and they stand on the brink of starvation. In spite of the great risk, a few brave folk tracked the hag back to her lair, a decrepit mansion in a nearby swamp. Unable to deal with Mabel themselves, they ask the characters for help.

Includes

A short adventure for 4-5 characters of 3rd to 4th level
A map of Mabel's Mildewed Mansion
Stat blocks for all monsters

boardgame.name: East Bound and Down
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What’s going on here?

We’ve got a long way to go and a short time to get there. Do we have the goods? Are the cops after us? A rival team?

Screw it, drive faster!

Movie night / From the Library / Game Night / At the Museum
Smokey and the Bandit 1-3

Ice Road Truckers

The Fast and the Furious 1-57

Gone in 60 Seconds

Need for Speed

This is a playset for the entirely awesome Fiasco, a game about powerful ambition and poor impulse control. Not the boxed set, the books. The books are better.

boardgame.name: The Joy (and Suffering) of Sex
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

If a vile scumbag has earned a carnal punishment from the gods, or a gutless worm is unable to decide which position they desire, this is the supplement for you.

Four--count them!--random tables compatible with MÖRK BORG. That's one table of social diseases including the Mislaid Heart of the Satisfying Execration and Blistering Pustules of Holy Penitence and a table full of new and exciting sexual positions like the Unholy Tripod of Eternal Ecstasy and Icy Claws of Eternal Mercy. Also two all-new tables to create evocative brothel names, like the Infernal House of Sticky Indulgence or The Bruised Ball.

It's a must for every game.

boardgame.name: The Burning Gash
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

High atop a crag of volcanic glass lies the prison known as The Burning Gash, so called for the jagged split running through the top of the mountain, glowing hot enough to burn all who touch it.

Nobody leaves. The administrators are serving life sentences as much as the prisoners. they are sent here for angering their superiors or owning something the local warlords want. The administrators are not happy to have this assignment.

Prisoners have been sent to the Burning Gash for centuries. The population grows, yet the food allocation has not changed since the founding. Food has to come from somewhere, and nothing grows on the scorching black glass.

Thankfully, the kitchens are near the fighting pit. Nobody is happy about that.

Imprisoned for a crime you most certainly committed, you need to escape. However, in your first hours in the Gash, you meet someone and need to either take them with you or take them out.

The Burning Gash is a prison break adventure compatible with MÖRK BORG.

boardgame.name: Mountain Rangers
森林守護者外傳：巡山員 (Forest Guardian Gaiden: Mountain Ranger)
boardgame.description:
Mountain Rangers is a standalone mini sequel of Forest Guardians, where players continue their mission to protect the forest and wildlife.

Throughout the game, players work on reforestation and animal rescue, while protecting mountains from wildfires and poachers. - description from game box.

Besides planting trees, players gain points when placing the wildlife in their proper habitats; also, putting out fire will produce victory points. The game ends once a player has planted all the forest meeples on their character boards.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 14
boardgame.description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 14 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

• Griffin IIC/IIC 2/IIC 9
• Sentinel STN-6S
• Exterminator EXT-7X
• Ostsol OTL-5M/8E/8E3/8F/C
• Nova (Black Hawk) T/G/I/J/K/L/R
• Lightning LHN-C5
• Thug THG-13U
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 15
boardgame.description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 15 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

• Fire Falcon T/F/G/I/L/R
• Black Lanner T/F/G/I/J/X
• Rawhide RWD-R1
• Thunderbolt TDR-7M/7S/8M/9S/9SE/9W/11S/12R/C/C 2
• Phoenix Hawk IIC/IIC 2/IIC 9/IIC 10
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 16
boardgame.description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 16 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:

• Locust LCT-1Vb/3D/3M/3S/5S/7S/7V/7V2/C
• Locust IIC/IIC 2/IIC 3/IIC 10
• Stormwolf Prime/A/B/C/D
• Ebon Jaguar (Cauldron-Born) T/E/F/G/X
• Turkina T/E/M/X
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Abuela Co.
boardgame.description:
In Colombia, every few years a cooking competition is held to highlight typical recipes from all regions of the country.
This is where a group of grandmothers who love cooking meet and display all their culinary knowledge in a fierce competition, where they decide who is the fastest and most seasoned grandmother.

Use your culinary skills to cook the most delicious Colombian dishes and be faster than your rivals to take home the title of Abuela Co. (Colombian Cooking Competition)

Abuela Co. is a game for 2 to 4 players, in which you will have to cook several typical dishes on a four-burner stove while avoiding other grandmothers to cook faster than you.

Play the cards on your stove. The grandmother who cooks 3 recipes finishes the game. The grandmother with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

boardgame.description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. • Rime Otter Prime/A/B/C/D
