• Iron Cheetah Prime/A/B/C/D/L
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Spotlight On Stone's Trackers
boardgame.description:
Backstabbers. Assassins. Cowards. Dezgra.

To the elite headhunters of Stone’s Trackers, these labels mean nothing. The only true measure of a warrior is success, and the Trackers will go to any length to ensure that Devlin Stone’s vision does not falter.

Forged in the flames of the Jihad from a secret Clan Nova Cat unit and comprised of Inner Sphere and Clan veterans alike, the Trackers take on the missions too dirty for regular commands to touch. Masters of infiltration, ambush, and marksmanship, they are the ghosts at the edge of the firelight, the wraiths that even MechWarriors have learned to fear.

From the battlefields of Operation SCOUR to glory of the Capellan Crusades, Stone’s Trackers hold to a code of honor of their own making, one that demands victory at any cost.

Spotlight On: Stone’s Trackers includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Spotlight On Holt's Hilltoppers
boardgame.description:
Born in the fires of Operation: GUERRERO, Holt’s Hilltoppers took on missions from the Periphery to the Chaos March, displaying grit and tenacity to rival any famed mercenary command. Action against Periphery pirates earned the Hilltoppers a reputation as savage defenders, but disaster during the St. Ives War nearly ended the command’s existence. Steadfast courage and resilience kept them together, aided by an alliance with Periphery renegades. Glory and infamy awaited in the FedCom Civil War, along with respect and eternal enmity in equal measure. Tiring of the vagabond life, the Hilltoppers found a new home outside the boundaries of the Inner Sphere. The Fronc Reaches offer constancy, but safety is always in short supply.

Spotlight On: Holt’s Hilltoppers includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Spotlight On Nakayama's Blood
boardgame.description:
When Federated Suns forces stormed into the Draconis Combine during the FedCom Civil War, proud samurai Chu-sa Harold Nakayama and the Forty-Sixth Dieron Regulars deployed to Ashio to repel the invaders. Disaster struck when an all-but-unknown mercenary command slaughtered Nakayama’s troops, humiliating him. Nakayama swore an oath to exterminate mercenaries wherever they tainted Combine soil, and gathered around him an independent company whose BattleMechs were anointed by the blood of their MechWarriors in an oath to seek out and destroy mercenary scum. The Jihad provided Nakayama’s Blood with rich hunting grounds and the opportunity to strike fear into the hearts of mercenaries operating anywhere near Combine territory.

Spotlight On: Nakayama’s Blood includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Spotlight On Crimson Seeker Star
boardgame.description:
In the right place, a few small rocks can change the course of a river. The Seekers of Clan Goliath Scorpion and the Escorpion Imperio have long sought out relics of the past which they believe will steer their course. But relics are not the only rocks: one small unit and its warriors changed the path of the Clan and the Imperio. The saKhan of fifty years who formed them. The Star Colonel who returned to guide them in their darkest hour. The survivors who escaped the Reavings to claim a new home. Those who continue to use the relics of the past to guide the future. Come discover the small rocks of the Crimson Seeker Star, who changed the course of the Seekers, the Goliath Scorpions, the Escorpion Imperio and many more.

Spotlight On: Crimson Seeker Star includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: ZweiKopfDämon
boardgame.description:
Bei ZweiKopfDämon werden zwei Spieler*innen in eine dämonische Welt eingesaugt. Dort kontrolliert ein*e Spieler*in zur Hälfte einen Dämon, der*die andere Spieler*in einen guten Charakter. Diese Kontrolle wechselt im Spiel immer wieder (wechselnde Spielleitung). Ziel des Spiels ist es, dieser Welt wieder zu entfliehen. Doch offen bleibt, ob die Flucht beiden zusammen gelingt oder ob doch jemand zum Vernichtungsschlag ansetzt.

Die Spieler*innen erzählen sich eine Geschichte in mehreren Runden. Vor Spielbeginn generieren sie zusammen in wenigen Schritten eine individuelle Dämonenwelt. Der Fantasie sind dabei kaum Grenzen gesetzt: Erlebnisse von Vampirjägern, Abenteuer auf einem Raumschiff oder gar eine dramatische Soap-Opera.

Ein essentieller Punkt des Spiels ist, dass der Dämon unheilvolle Situationen heraufbeschwört, die dann der Charakter lösen muss. Doch genau in diesen brenzligen Situationen kann es zum Rollenwechsel der Spielleitung kommen. Die ausgetüftelte Falle kann somit schnell zum selbst geschaufelten Grab werden.

ZweiKopfDämon zeichnet sich dadurch aus, dass es anpassbar ist. Die Spieler*innen können die Schwierigkeit individuell anpassen und zwischen den verschiedenen Spielmodi (kooperativ, semi-kooperativ, kompetitiv) wählen. Das Spiel eignet sich vorallem für Spieler*innen, die sehr kreativ sind und Spaß daran haben, sich aus verzwickten Situationen herauszuwinden. Es ist darauf ausgerichtet an einem Abend in ungefähr 60-90 Minuten gespielt zu werden. Die Regeln sind überschaubar und es lässt sich auch prima über das Internet spielen.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Spotlight On Unending Faith
boardgame.description:
Nearly every faith in human history has had its militant, stalwart protectors of the light ready to cast down those who would question the true path. The vision of Blessed Blake is no different. The creation of the Republic and its disbanding of the Com Guard cast a deep shadow, but true faith endures. Now, amid a Dark Age, the light of Blake is needed more than ever and the Blessed Order stands ready to share it with the Inner Sphere. For the warriors of Unending Faith, the end of the Com Guard was only the beginning.

Spotlight On: Unending Faith includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Spotlight On First Marik Protectors
boardgame.description:
In the fires of the Jihad, a handful of brave souls placed honor before duty, service before survival, and the people of their shattered nation before all others.

Considered traitors by some but heroes by those they watch over, the First Marik Protectors rose from the ashes of the Free Worlds League to protect worlds at the far-flung edge of their fallen nation. An elite cadre of warriors, the Protectors’ dedication to safeguarding the lives of their countrymen is nearly unmatched in the Inner Sphere.

The Marik Protectors exist to offer a single hope to the citizens of these outcast worlds: that when darkness closes in, there will be a light shining for them, a hammer and anvil to smite any who would disrupt their peace, a shield against all the ills the Periphery holds. Protectors, behind whom they may rest.

Spotlight On: First Marik Protectors includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Spotlight On Thermo Police
boardgame.description:
Beyond the edge of acknowledged civilization lie the Outworlds Wastes. Planets abandoned by the Star League centuries ago. Governments shattered by apathy, obscurity, and the march of time struggle to provide even the most basic needs of their people. From these meager surroundings one small but zealously dedicated unit stands to serve and protect the remnants of their realm. The Thermo Police may be enrolled as mercenaries but in truth they patrol these lawless stars seeking to bring the order they once knew. Specializing in non-lethal tactics, and trained beyond the typical pirates and bandits prowling the Wastes, their next encounter could be from past the distant stars they call home. But will it be a threat or an opportunity?

Spotlight On: Thermo Police includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Spotlight On The Crazy Eights
boardgame.description:
There is no company more fitting as heralds of the Davion sword and sunburst than the Crazy Eights, and even fewer regiments in the AFFS with as storied and lengthy history as the Eighth Company of the Twentieth Avalon Hussars. Disbanded and lost during the Word of Blake’s Jihad, the Crazy Eights were reformed when the call to war once again compelled the Federated Suns to raise new regiments for the protection of the realm. Now, as House Davion’s ancient enemy bears down on New Avalon in this new Dark Age, the Crazy Eights are one of the few to stand in the Dragon’s path.

Spotlight On: The Crazy Eights includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Battletech: Spotlight On Schmidt's Petraries
boardgame.description:
Captain-Marshal Rudolf Schmidt took command of the Hanseatic Defense Force at a critical juncture. The nearby Scorpion Empire posed an existential threat to the Hanseatic League. While reorganizing the HDF, he recognized a crucial need for an elite company to inspire the troops. Thus was born Schmidt’s Petraries, the HDF’s overall command company and home to the best of the best. Intense training with their comrades was far different from the trial by fire that the Petraries faced when the Scorpion Empire finally invaded. The Petraries rose to the occasion, defying the fearsome invaders and inspiring a nation with their deeds.

Spotlight On: Schmidt’s Petraries includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat

boardgame.name: Wired Neon Cities: Augmented
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Edizione Italiana di Wired Neon Cities di Scott Malthouse (Trollish Delver Games).

In 7 pagine, trovate classi, oggetti e regolamento. Include due schede (a colori e printer friendly).

Non include il materiale di ambientazione del prodotto originale, ma troverete alcune opzioni inedite (tra cui diverse classi aggiuntive!) che verranno ulteriormente espanse in una futura release.

boardgame.name: Evolving 6
Evolving6
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

One System, Infinite Worlds!

Evolving6 is the roleplaying game engine powering DreamBooks, mini-settings including genre rules, an introductory scenario and all you need to create, grow and develop the Dream of atypical characters... While the Nightmare will find engaging tools to generate new hooks and evergoing challenges!

With a lightning fast spirit inspired by the old school gaming and a lot of modern tweaks to enhance cooperative storytelling, Evolving6 + DreamBooks represent our desire to provide you a fun, deep and versatile roleplaying experience!


System Features

Evolving6 is built around the use of a single d6: the Difficulty, starting at 2 and set within a "roll for high" logic, will switch constantly... Shifting into the result of every roll! This constant... Chaotic Evolution, paired with the Nightmare's Talent system and Fixes (narrative details players can introduce to change the game world), make Ev6 a unique game, quick and tense!

To make things even more dangerous, we added a lethal twist: a single unavoided hit means the victim is defeated, but she can avoid this tragic end by destroying items, paying with resources and suffering Traumas.

You can find all of this in a single A5 sheet! Using this little/big ruleset and a DreamBook of your choice, you will be able to embody countless adventures!


Un sistema, mondi infiniti!

Evolving6 è il sistema di gioco di ruolo che alimenta i DreamBook, mini-ambientazioni tematiche che includono le regole specifiche, uno scenario introduttivo e tutto il necessario per creare, crescere e sviluppare il Sogno di personaggi atipici e rinnegati… Mentre l’Incubo troverà strumenti per creare spunti di avventura e sfide costanti!

Con un animo fulmineo ispirato alla vecchia scuola e integrazioni narrative volte allo sviluppo di storie condivise, Evolving6 e Dreambook rappresentano il nostro desiderio di regalarvi un modo di fare GdR profondo, versatile e leggero al tempo stesso!!


Caratteristiche del Sistema

Evolving6 ruota attorno al lancio di un d6; la Difficoltà, inizialmente pari a 2 in una logica "roll above" e individuale, muta a seconda del risultato ottenuto! Questa costante... Evoluzione caotica, affiancata dal sistema di Talenti dei Sogni e dell'Incubo (il GM) e dei Fix (elementi narrativi introdotti dai giocatori, rendono Ev6 un gioco unico, rapido e sempre teso!

A rendere le cose ancor più perigliose è una letalità particolare: un singolo colpo andato a segno decreta la sconfitta di una vittima, ma questa può evitare la tragica fine distruggendo oggetti, spendendo preziose risorse o acquisendo Traumi.

Tutto questo e molto altro in una singola facciata A5! Con questo piccolo / grande regolamento e un qualsiasi DreamBook potrete dare vita a un gran numero di avventure!

boardgame.name: XenoDreamers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Journey Begins!

Welcome! This is the first step in one of many worlds you'll discover in our DreamBooks, self contained scenarios built to be learnt and played in a split second, highly customisable and focused on atypical alter ego chasing ambitious dreams and projects in contrast with the Nightmare, an appropriate nemesis portrayed by the game master.

XenoDreamers is the first volume of the DreamBook product line, a series of complete mini-settings containing specific rules, customization options, an introductory scenario and tools for the Nightmare (the GM).

Why "DreamBook"? And what is XenoDreamers?

Under this gaming model, every Ancestry has a Dream developing Session after Session and that will deeply change the game world. Every setting will allow the in depth exploration of a specific type of characters: in XenoDreamers, you'll roleplay alien settlers, would it be in the clothes of the smart and weird Horrors or through the Alpha Clones master infiltrators. You will cooperate or even get lost into conflictual and secret objectives, while the Nightmare will throw at you all the goodness of an evergrowing Huaman Resistance (Organizations, rebellion, wars!).

Under the core rules descriptions at the provided link, you'll find a comprehensive description of the system. At the very core, you will have a lightning fast, quick ruleset packed up with a lot of narrative potential, enhanced by the genre rules you will find in all DreamBooks (i.e, in XenoDreamers you will find rules for special items and starships!).

What's in XenoDreamers?

In 16, tablet friendly and awesomly illustrated pages, you'll find:
- setting introduction

- two Ancestries, each with its own Secrets, Dream Talents and specific Powers.

- a Nigthmare section, including hints and typical Dangers

- rules to handle Starhsip combat

- and introductory scenario with 4 pregenerated Alter Ego

- the Alter Ego sheet, you'll use as a small dashboard.

What can I play with XenoDreamers?

Many different tropes! From the typical adventures of Men in Black or Mars Attack, through the darker themes of War of the Worlds, with many different, darker or brighter tones, at your own likings. You can narrate deadly firefights, straight intrigue scenes and infiltration while introducing quick and brutal cinematic moments, using the system's ease of use and its storytelling versatility, granting every player a huge amount of control over the on and off screen events!


Inizia il viaggio!

Benvenuti! Questo è il primo passo in uno dei mondi che troverete nei DreamBook, scenari pensati per essere appresi e giocati rapidamente, fortemente personalizzabili e incentrati su alter ego atipici che inseguono ambiziosi progetti in contrasto con l'Incubo, una nemesi adeguata al tema interpretata dal game master.

XenoDreamers è il primo volume della linea DreamBook, una serie di mini-ambientazioni complete di regole specifiche, personalizzazione, uno scenario introduttivo e strumenti per l'Incubo (il GM).

In questo modello di gioco, ogni Retaggio interpretato ha un Sogno che si sviluppa durante le Sessioni e che da luogo a mutamenti irreversibili del mondo di gioco. Ogni ambientazione da la possiblità di esplorare un genere e un tipo specifico di personaggi: nel caso di XenoDreamers, interpreterete alieni colonizzatori, da ingegnosi e insoliti Orrori ad astuti e determinati Cloni. Potrete collaborare o persino scontrarvi, mentre l'Incubo incarnerà la Resistenza Umana (Organizzazioni, cortei, ribellione, guerre!).

Al link per scaricare Evolving6 qui su DriveThru trovate un'ampia descrizione del sistema. In sostanza, avrete un regolamento snello, fulmineo e denso di potenziale narrativo, affiancato da regole "di genere" espresse di volta in volta nei DreamBook (nel caso di XenoDreamers, per esempio, trovarete regole per oggetti speciali e astronavi!).

Cosa trovo in XenoDreamers?

In sedici pagine splendidamente illustrate a colori, troverete:
- introduzione al setting

- due Retaggi, ciascuno con i rispettivi Segreti, Talenti per sviluppare il Sogno e Poteri specifici

- sezione per l'Incubo, inclusiva di consigli e Pericoli tipici

- regolamento per gestire i combattimenti da Astronavi

- uno scenario introduttivo e 4 personaggi pregenerati

- scheda dell'Alter Ego

Cosa posso giocare con XenoDreamers?
Tantissimi tipi di storie! Dalle storie tipiche di Men in Black e Mars Attack, passando per la Guerra dei Mondi e tonalità più cupe o più spensierate, a vostro piacimento! Potete narrare letali scontri a fuoco, scene di puro intrigo e incursione e inserire momenti fulminei e cinematografici, sfruttando la rapidità del sistema e la sua versatilità narrativa che da a ogni giocatore grande potere su quanto accade "on / off screen" !

boardgame.name: Don't Split
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Don't Split is a standalone, dark fantasy roleplaying game using a variant build of Evolving6.

In Don't Split you create a Party, a Guild and a Town, cooperating to set up the right background for your stories! This is a fast and creative process requiring mere minutes, if you wish!

Then, the Splitter will create your first Quest and boom: you're ready to explore the world!
With a lightning fast and deadly resolution system (with a ton of built in modern mechanics) you will be able to face extraordinary adventures, go back to your hub, hire mercenaries, get some news around the Town and be ready for another Quest!

In Don't Split the Party is KEY: you are not handling a set of "hit points" per character, nor you'll have individual resources: items and class features aside, the whole group will share a number of power points, which represent a metacurrency to fuel class powers and to avoid defeat! So, you'll need to make careful choices: will you cast your powerful Elemental storm lowering the Party's chance of survival or will you play with cunning actions in order to save some points for the big boss?

WHAT'S IN THE BOOK?
This wonderfully illustraded 22 pages fully Bookmarked PDF include:

- Complete Rules

- Guidelines to cooperative Guild and Party creation

- Guidelines to introduce fantasy races

- 13 pre-made Classes for you to print out (like the Alchemist, Inquisitor and Druid!)

- Customised Class Creation

- Optional Rules and Variants

- Sample Town for a quickstart!

- Custom Alter Ego Sheet

- a Toolkit with magic items, dangers, quest generation, special abilities and conditions!


Don't Split é un gioco di ruolo dark fantasy standalone, fondato su una versione elaborata appositamente del nostro sistema Evolving 6.

E' un gioco di ruolo Dark Fantasy incentrato sulla Compagnia: i giocatori cooperano per creare un gruppo di avventurieri, una Gilda tematica e una Cittadina che la ospita, popolandola di leggende, volti e accadimenti. Questo sarà l'hub che la Compagnia sfrutterà per riprendersi tra una Quest e l'altra.

Lo Splitter creerà le Quest, richieste di lavoro apprpriate (o la Compagnia deciderà di farsi di tanto in tanto un giro in città a caccia di lavori all'altezza!).

Al termine di ogni Quest, nuovi aspiranti avventurieri si faranno avanti: questi Mercenari potranno essere portati in missione e, in futuro (se sopravvissuti!) potranno essere promossi a membri effettivi della Gilda, fornendo maggiore supporto (e dando spessore alla Gilda come insieme di persone molto diverse tra loro, unite da uno scopo comune!).

Attenzione però... gli Alter Ego in Don't Split non sono degli individui, non soltanto almeno: la Compagnia ha una risorsa comune chiamata Punti Potere che svolge varie funzioni, tra cui evitare atroci sconfitte e alimentare i poteri delle Classi!

Esattamente: i punti vita della Compagnia sono (in astratto) anche la sua risorsa! Deciderete che l'incantatore lanci la sua Tempesta Elementale per risolvere rapidamente una brutta situazione o preferirete usare l'astuzia e tenere da parte preziose risorse per lo scontro finale?

Queste scelte sono letteralmente vitali e caratterizzano lo stile fulmineo e letale di Don't Split!

A queste dinamiche, si affiancano strumenti moderni come la narrazione dei Fix (dettagli narrativi che possono essere aggiunti consumando punti potere) e altre meccaniche adatte a portare l'avventura classica nel linguaggio odierno!

Nel gioco, inoltre, le Classi sono dei contenitori concettuali: oltre a una serie di Classe già create e pronte all'uso, potrete creare Classi personalizzate con grande semplicità, dando vita a qualsiasi forma di tema abbiate in mente!
Il tutto, nello stile semplice e profondo dei nostri giochi!

COSA TROVO NEL MANUALE?
In questo PDF di 22 pagine, splendidamente illustrato a colori, trovate:

- Regolamento completo

- Linee guida per la creazione e lo sviluppo di Compagnia, Gilda e Cittadina

- Consigli per lo Splitter

- Introduzione di Razze Fantasy

- 13 Classi pregenerate, suddivise in schede stampabili e pronte per l'avventura!

- Linee Guida per la creazione di Classi e Talenti personalizzati!

- Varianti e Regole opzionali per il Gioco Eroico, le One2One e il combattimento tattico!

- Una cittadina esempio con spunti utili per iniziare subito!

- Un Toolkit molto nutrito con oggetti magici, condizioni, talenti, Pericolo e un generatore di Quest!

boardgame.name: Football Story Combos
boardgame.description:
Football combo story is a football-themed game that can be played alone or with two players in confrontation.

A match takes place over 2 halves during which you will have to resolve 8 phases of the game: 4 offensives and 4 defenses.
It's up to you to manage your workforce well to meet the objectives to defend or score goals.

boardgame.name: Nuuk
boardgame.description:
Nuuk is a Print & Play card game to play solo or with two players. Each poker-sized card has one of Greenland's coastal villages - visit a new village each time you turn over a card. Starting with just a couple of basic resources, your aim is to gain as much money as you can in order to pay for your sea passage home, before you run out of time.

Trade resources and learn new local skills as you travel between villages. Skills will gain you benefits later in the game, or help you avoid penalties, but learning a new skill means spending more precious time in that village. You'll need to decide when to invest in skills and when to push on to the next village.

With multiple solo and two player modes, this pocket sized game will keep you thinking for hours.

boardgame.name: Master Strikes
boardgame.description:
Master Strikes is a high skill-cap 15th century German longsword card game where players honor-duel to the first cut. The game utilizing authentic fighting stances, swing types from each stance, and counter moves which force players to change stances in order to react.

Master Strikes relies on deduction and memory, as well as chess-like strategy to outwit your foe. The game is easy to learn and hard to master, with several balanced methods to find an advantage.

boardgame.name: My English is under all pig
boardgame.description:
"My English is under all pig" is a card game about common phrases. If you translate German idioms into the English language you don't get the correct English equivalent, but rather a funny English sentence. Then it's not English, it's Denglish ("D" for Deutsch = German). So one by one the players draw a card and have to translate the Denglish sentences into German and then also have to find the correct English forms.

If a player can translate the Denglish phrase into German and then correctly into English they can keep the card. The more cards the players collect the more points they earn. Whoever earns most points wins.
boardgame.boardgameintegration: Now goes me a light up
Now goes me a light up

boardgame.name: BookWorms
boardgame.description:
BookWorms is a simple word search game where players, acting as worms, find letters in adjacent books to form words.

PLAY IN ROUNDS

Play at least two rounds. Each round consists of setup and game play until the draw piles are depleted.

GAME PLAY

On each turn, the current player …

Examines letters adjacent to and in a path of letters from their location.
Calls out a word using any nearby letters and optionally one letter from a draw pile.
Moves their bookworm to the location of the last letter used.
Collects all the book tiles used.
Places the tiles collected upside down in front of them.
Takes a random tile from the draw pile and places it face up on any empty board space.
Moves the mole.


The mole is used to steal a random book from an adjacent bookworm.

Making a Move

Move your bookworm onto a location where the first letter will be used to form your word. The location must be adjacent to, or within a continuous “tunnel” of five empty spaces from your worm’s current position. However, you cannot move next to, or pass next to the mole.
The word will be a combination of adjacent letters in sequential order and optionally a letter or bigram from any draw pile.
Call out the word for others to verify.
Pick up the tiles used and them place in front of you upside down.
Move the worm to the location of the last letter used.


TIP: Try to use letters with the highest values.

Moving the Mole
The current player moles the mole at the end of their turn. The mole is moved onto a book tile whose letter matches the first letter of the word just made.
If the mole is moved next to a worm, that player loses one of their collected letter tiles at random. The current player selects one of the that player’s tiles and places it face up on a random board location.

ENDING THE ROUND
When all players agree that no more words can be formed, the game is over.
Each player tallies their collected books’ points and records them on a score sheet. Repeat the setup and play at least one more round.
Repeat the setup and play at least two rounds.

ENDING THE GAME
At the end of the last round, the winner will have the most points. In case of a tie, the youngest player wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: BAM!: Fußball-Spezial
boardgame.description: This is an expansion pack for BAM! of 5 red and 17 grey cards that are all themed around soccer.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BAM! Ihr habt es so gewollt!

boardgame.name: Kuala: Abenteuerbogen
boardgame.description: A character sheet for Kuala. You can write on it with a non-permanent marker and clean it again to reuse it in your next adventure.

boardgame.name: BlazeRush
boardgame.description:
Blaze Rush is a dynamic arcade racing survival game with no health, no levelling and no brakes!
You can assemble a team of friends to play in local or online multiplayer, choose a car to your taste and chase, blow up and cut off! Adapt your style and tactics to new enemies, obstacles and tracks.
Welcome to the world of racing and frantic fun!

Key features:

Simple multiplayer. Up to 4 players locally and up to 8 players over the Internet.
Couch vs. couch. Start races with local players
Connect to the game at any time.
Dozens of fun tracks on three planets, 16 cars and a variety of cool guns.
Lots of medals for various tricks and antics.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: SORCERY
boardgame.description:
From Introduction
Where SWORD focused on the primary player rules in a MAZES game, SORCERY will focus on the real magic of fantasy role-playing. This books details the magic that lies in creating your own characters, as well as actual Magic.

boardgame.name: MAZE
boardgame.description:
From Introduction

I am the Maze Controller

"I am the maze controller. Only I know the perilous course you are about to take. Your fate s in my hands!"

-Rona Jaffe, Mazes and Monsters

boardgame.name: MONSTER
boardgame.description:
From Back of Book

The Rules for hazards, monsters, and traps - with three ready to play mazes

boardgame.name: SPRING
boardgame.description:
From Back of Book

The Rules for Sky Magic, the Scholarship Aspect, hazards and adventures in high places, and more.

boardgame.name: STORM
boardgame.description:
From Back of Book

The Rules for Sea Magic, the Seafarer Aspect, nautical hazards and adventures, rules updates, and more.

boardgame.name: SUMMER
boardgame.description:
From Back of Book

Rules for Forge magic, the Station Aspect for characters of high standing and charisma, hazards and adventures in castles, rules and rulings, a complete maze module, and more.

boardgame.name: AUTUMN
boardgame.description:
From Back of Book

Rules for Earth magic, the Sylvan Aspect, hazards and adventures in dark forests, a complete ready to run maze module, new rules updates, and more.

boardgame.name: WINTER
boardgame.description:
From Back of Book

Rules for Night Magic, the Shadow Aspect, hazards and adventures in dark and winter, a complete ready to run maze module, new rules updates, and more.

boardgame.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Black Panther
boardgame.description:
King T'Challa and Queen Storm call upon the full might of Wakanda to combat the forces of evil, not only for Wakanda, but for the entire planet!


The Black Panther comes to Legendary to join the amazing collection of Super Heroes in this 29th Expansion to the vast Legendary landscape!
Five Heroes! Two new Masterminds and Villains groups!
Players can work both with and against other players to defeat the Mastermind!
Join Black Panther, Storm, and more in the fight against the Enemies of Wakanda!
All cards will feature original art! 100 cards in total!
Requires the Marvel Legendary Core Set to play.


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Dawn of Iron: The American Civil War at Sea – 1861-1865
boardgame.description:
Dawn of Iron: The American Civil War at Sea, is a game of naval combat, set during American Civil War (1861-1865). While many think of the war’s naval campaigns as a static blockade, the truth is that it was actually just as desperate and bloody as other aspects of the conflict. From the coastal regions of Virginia and the muddy rivers of the Mississippi Valley to the far flung freezing waters of Alaska’s Bering Strait, Union and Confederate navies fought for dominance.

Dawn of Iron puts you in command of a Civil War-era vessel, or a full squadron of them. Assemble your fleet, engage the enemy, and send them to the bottom!

The 24-page Dawn of Iron rulebook includes all the rules you'll need to play in a concise 15-pages with diagrams and illustrations. There's also a few pages dedicated to open sea and coastal battlefields that you will fight on (riverine coming soon!) and four general play missions that should get you sailing in no time!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: High Noon: Grizzly Greenwood
boardgame.description:
From the deep woods of Timber Heights comes the silent big game hunter, Henry "Grizzly" Greenwood. With his sturdy long rifle, near limitless supply of bear traps and a loyal pack of wolfhounds by his side, Henry has collected many trophies in his career and has now set his iron sights on more challenging prey.

The Grizzly Greenwood posse is one of corral and control. Greenwood's bear traps make his targets think twice about taking their next step, while his wolves can pounce and maul their prey, keeping them in one vulnerable location for Henry to pick off at a safe distance with his rifle.

boardgame.name: High Noon: Starter Set Card Boxes
boardgame.description: Keep storage a breeze with these protective card boxes for your High Noon Starter Set cards! Includes a box for each posse and loot deck (seven total).

boardgame.name: High Noon: 3D Chips & Gold Upgrade Pack
boardgame.description:
Upgrade your tokens with these 3D Chips & Gold Bars!

24 Gold Bars
9 Red Chips
12 Blue Chips
3 Green Chips

boardgame.name: High Noon: Minis Crate
boardgame.description: Protect and store your minis in this stylish and sturdy High Noon strongbox.

boardgame.name: High Noon: Marketplace
boardgame.description:
Up the ante on the carnage and speed up the pace of the game with the Marketplace expansion! Did your enemy loot the last crate? One shot left in your shotgun? Now you can use your hard-earned gold to purchase more loot and keep your posse armed to the teeth! For the best experience, play with the starting tiles that come with Monco & McAtte, The Jenkins Brothers and The Abernathy Gang.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: High Noon: Expansion Loot – Volume 1
boardgame.description:
Expand your loot options with 45 colorful items including all new rations, holsters, and powerful and experimental weapons!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Karak: Miniature Set
boardgame.description:
Set of 6 highly detailed 5 cm miniatures for base game Karak, which replace the cardboard hero standees.

Contents: 6 miniatures, 6 colored rings
Dimensions: 20 x 8 x 3 cm

boardgame.name: Karak: Expansion Miniature Set
boardgame.description:
Set of 8 highly detailed miniatures for both expansions of Karak, which replace the cardboard hero standees.

Contents: 8 miniatures, 8 colored rings
Dimensions: 25 x 8 x 3 cm

boardgame.name: Kreisverkehr
boardgame.description:
The ideal family fun for everyone!
Playable in many variations with or without rotating wheel.
First one to get all pieces into the target area wins.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Kreisverkehr is a variant of Malefiz. In this variant, a part of the board can rotate, and it is rotated whenever a player rolls multiple sixes in a row.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Ultraviolent Floating Halls
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Once belonging to a wealthy and noble family of ill intent. Legend tells that one fateful night, amid Samhain, the patriarch of the noble family, despite all his worshipping and hard work has seen that the fruits of his labour were rotten, and his harvest was spoiled.

He spent his last remaining wealth on an ancient tome, adorned with withered flesh.

Unable to live with this shame, his damaged ego and his failing mind. He drove himself to madness, remaining in the cellar for weeks on end, toying away with rituals he didn't understand from the ancient tome.

No one knows the full truth of what happened next, but the groundskeeper gave the most accurate eyewitness account, as the only survivor of the night. He disclosed that the father, using his woodcutting axe, massacred his family. He hasn't been seen since.

boardgame.name: Silver Secrets Buried Deep
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

Silver Secrets Buried Deep is a Fifth Edition Adventure for three to five characters of 3rd to 4th level. It is optimized for a party of four characters with an average party level (APL) of 4. Parties equipped with magical items and weapons will have an easier time than those without.

This adventure sees the party investigate a dwarven mine stronghold under the Monkrath Mountains. This one-shot adventure can be placed into any mountainous region or mine setting. This is the second chapter in the "The Dark Below" adventure path. It can be played as the continuation of the story from Darkness Rises Under The Great Silver Hall for the larger adventure setting, or as a one-shot adventure for your players.

boardgame.name: Darkness Gathers Under the Great Silver Hall
boardgame.description:
From itch.io:

An Underdark adventure. Investigate a dwarven mine stronghold under the Monkrath Mountains. Can be placed into any mountainous region or mine setting. Ch. 1 of “The Dark Below” adventure path. Can be played as a kickoff for larger adventure settings or a one-shot adventure for your players.

This is the first in a two-part adventure working with Monster Brew DM (Jamie Brannan). His unique encounter design really shines in this Underdark adventure for three to fix adventurers of 3rd or 4th level. If you like the Underdark adventures, this series has what you want.

King Bderg Giantsmasher and his clan built their mine stronghold under Monkrath Mountains some 200 years ago. They drove out monsters that dwelt within the caves under the mountain and for their efforts were rewarded a steady stream of silver to mine. Naming the mine, Eth Stjora Zilvren Helgot.

However, what they had not told anyone was that the monsters were at the command of drow. These dark masters had sought to use the creatures as a way to clear a path for an advancing drow army. They sought to wreak havoc on an unsuspecting surface world.

Clan Giansmasher fought the enemy back into the depth of the caves. Bderg cut down the leader of the drow Agthar’Yaz-inyon casting them into the darkness below before ordering the passage sealed shut, cutting the drow off from the surface. Or so they thought.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Lone Star
boardgame.description:
Cold, desolate, long-abandoned and looted of any treasures centuries ago, Lone Star was once a crown jewel of the Terran Hegemony and bold achievement of terraforming. In Touring the Stars: Lone Star, players learn about Volgadon and the Pond Cities and their disparate and fabulous architectures, discover why Lone Star was a major agriculture and manufacturing center for the Terran Hegemony...and read how the horrors of the Amaris Civil War and the First Succession War set this once-great world onto the path towards oblivion.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Benet III
boardgame.description:
The mineral-rich planet Benet III served as a place of industry, a base for military forces and as a home to a hearty, stubborn populace--a people who survived the Succession Wars, the FedCom Civil War and the Jihad, only to all but wiped out by the fickle planet itself. In Touring the Stars: Benet III, players learn about the planet's constant volcanic and seismic activity, as well as the infamous "Death Mists" that eventually led to the disastrous end of Benet III.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Bone Norman
boardgame.description:
A stark world on the fringes of the Inner Sphere, Bone Norman's desolate, haunting geography can spook even the most experienced warrior. A sleepy backwater planet for most of its history, Bone Norman vaunted to the front lines of the Clan Invasion and Jihad. In Touring the Stars: Bone-Norman, players learn about the planet's interesting flora and fauna, as well as the mysterious Föhnkrankheit, or "wind sickness"? brought on by the planet's unique geography.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG
boardgame.description:
It is the 31st century. Mankind has spread to the stars and spawned titanic stellar empires, each controlling hundreds of worlds across a thousand light years and beyond. Yet the sins of man have followed him from the cradle of humanity.

Political machinations of feudal lords plunge whole sectors into war; unscrupulous merchant starship captains smuggle weapons to their own faction's enemies; greedy military commanders demand tribute from worlds they're protecting; animalistic pirate kings harvest high technologies and human slaves in lightning raids; betrayals from oath-bound allies leave honorable soldiers growing cold on forgotten worlds; death at the tip of knife from a concubine turned assassin to avenge a world and love lost: it is a time of war.

What empire will you swear allegiance to: a warrior merchant of House Steiner; the honorbound samurai of House Kurita; the vat-bred warriors of the Clans; a mercenary that fights only for the highest bidder?

Choose your life in the universe: a MechWarrior piloting the thirty-foot-tall BattleMechs that turn the tide of any battle; a spy deep behind enemy lines discovering critical secrets; a merchant carrying critical supplies; a scientist unleashing the latest cutting edge technologies?

How will YOU become a legend?
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: Empire Alone – An ilClan Era Sourcebook
Battletech: Historical – Liberation of Terra vol 1
Battletech: Historical – Liberation of Terra vol 2
BattleTech: House Arano – The Aurigan Coalition
BattleTech: Masters and Minions – The StarCorps Dossiers
BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Benet III
BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Bone Norman
BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Butte Hold
BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Gulf Breeze
Battletech: Touring the Stars – Iron Land
Battletech: Touring the Stars – Kerensky's Vision
Battletech: Touring the Stars – Lone Star
Battletech: Touring the Stars – McEvedy's Folly
Battletech: Touring the Stars – Old Kentucky
Battletech: Touring the Stars – Promised Land
Battletech: Touring the Stars – Regis Roost
Battletech: Touring the Stars – Rigil Kentarus
Battletech: Touring the Stars – Tortuga Prime
Battletech: Touring the Stars – Wynn's Roost

boardgame.name: Bibi & Tina: Mädchen gegen Jungs
boardgame.description:
The players collect clues on clue squares to exchange them for 4 star cards. In addition, the 3 girls' pieces must be moved to the target square before the boys' piece. The figures are moved by a dice roll.
The collected clues are immediately deposited in a cloth bag. When a player thinks they can acquire one of the 4 face-up star cards, clue cards are drawn from the cloth bag. Clue cards that do not match are lost.

—user summary

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 1 bis 4 Spieldauer: 30 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 7+
Bibi & Tina: Freundschaftsbändchen - Mitbringspiel Bibi und Tina sind beste Freundinnen und haben sich bunte Freundschaftsbändchen geknüpft, um ihre enge Freundschaft zu zeigen. Mit diesem Komplett-Set kann es jeder ganz einfach nachmachen. Direkt loslegen und tolle Freundschaftsbändchen knüpfen. Mit Perlen und Anhängern verziert, werden daraus ganz leicht echte Schmuckstücke. Knüpfspaß, der verbindet, garantiert!
Inhalt: 80 Perlen 9 Anhänger 1 Anleitung 1 Sicherheitsnadel Garn in 4 Farben
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE, EN, FR, IT, ES, NL

boardgame.name: Star Lard 235
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A tasty TREAT before hyper SLEEP!

But make sure to read the label...

boardgame.name: Canned Space Kraken
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Canned Space Krakens, an illegal delicacy throughout known space, canned for your convenice in psychic SOY sauce.

boardgame.name: Battletech: Touring the Stars – Manassas
boardgame.description:
The victim of a devastating cosmic impact and war, Manassas is still one of the Inner Sphere's safest planets, except for the so-called "Dead Zones"? dotting the world. In Touring the Stars: Manassas, players will learn about the famed Manassas Run, an annual world-spanning treasure hunt for valuable LosTech where anything goes and the prize of becoming Run Champion is all that matters.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: BattleTech: A Game of Armored Combat
BattleTech: A Time of War – The BattleTech RPG

boardgame.name: The Peach
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Peach is something organic...something in the icebox....someone was saving to finish later.
Do you want to finish it for them? And what to do with the leftovers...

boardgame.name: Live Bait
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this short standalone one-shot adventure, Legionnaires are confronted with a quick-growing, highly adhesive and nearly indestructable substance that threatens to overgrow and suffocate them. As if things weren't bad enough, this new sticky menace also attracts The Grimm from all over the verse, so Legionnaires will have to act quick if they want to live to see another day.

There are some promising chemicals on board of the starship that might safe the Legionnaires' butts, but it sure won't be a walk in the park to get to them...

NOTE: As this is the outline from an adventure, it is only meant to be read by the GM. Spoilled Spoils Spoiler Alert!

boardgame.name: Extant Leftovers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Part mystery meat, part back up organs, and a few random mechanical pits for good measure. You are bio waste molded multiple times over until reaching sentience.

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 13
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

A single mother is planning on eliminating the gangs that killed her son
A master carpenter is trapped into fixing up a haunted manor house
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 14
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

A cleric is on a mission of healing to a village that's on fire
A cave that grants miracles is being visited by witches and a grieving widow
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: Der Brügger Parade
De Brugse Zotten Parade
La Parade des Foux de Bruges
Parade of the Bruges Fools
boardgame.description:
The government of Maximilian, who inherited the reign over Bruges in 1482, is harsh and taxes are high, leading to public discontent. When Maximilian visited Bruges in 1488, the people decided to revolt. They were able to imprison their monarch for over four months. Out of vengeance, Maximilian imposed a prohibition to organize festivities and fairs. To calm him down, you as the people of Bruges decided to organize a celebration to honor Maximilian.

In Parade of the Bruges fools players take on the role of a medieval labourer living in Bruges. Together, you try to gather musicians, acrobats and jesters to join a big parade in honour of Maximilian in order to earn his respect and therefore more freedom. However, the player who surpasses the expectations of grumpy Maximilian, wins this game and becomes mayor in Bruges.

Each turn, players perform one of three actions:

persuade an artist by offering a drink in the local bar
play an artist into the parade and score (some artists have the possibility to move other cards one space or to swap with a card)
rest (by taking back into your hand all of the cards you needed to persuade artists)


When an artist reached the seventh column, the parade is complete and the game ends.

In the advanced game mood bonusses are dealt to the player(s) who took most notice of the King's temper (3 out of 20 mission cards).

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 16
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Brilling Strongarm - male human blacksmith
Crulagh - male human sorcerer
Shashwininda Fathax - female sea-elf assassin
Ullag - male orc sorcerer

boardgame.name: The Witch: Hexes, Tinctures, and Bonded Magic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Witches channel magical power through practiced ritual and tradition rather than exerting force upon ambient magics about them. This harmonious relationship gives them a wide variety of spellcasting abilities, from delivering potent hexes and curses, to crafting restorative tinctures and poultices, to bolstering allies with wards and harmonious magics.

Building off of the existing Fifth Edition rules for character creation, this PDF introduces a new class, the Witch. These adventurers use magic derived from their relationships with allies, enemies, and the world around them to protect allies and fight their foes.

This PDF contains five subclasses for the witch:

The Constellation Affinity, who teleports about a battlefield to deliver opportune attacks and evade danger.
The Crystal Affinity, who creates magical equipment in order to weather enemies' attacks.
The Familiar Affinity, who inspires their allies to action and flies about on a broomstick.
The Herb Affinity, whose mastery of medicinal and magical plants allows potions to last far longer and bolsters their allies' health.
The Hex Affinity, who exert forceful control over their enemies through punishing curses.


This PDF also contains 50 new spells, ranging in level from cantrip to 9th level to make your witch characters truly unique to your campaign.

boardgame.name: Monsters Mythica: Terrors of the Deep Woods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

3 Brand New Creature Options For 5th Edition

There are woods so deep and so dark that they mirror the ocean in their mystery and grandeur. Where creatures who count their years in the crumbling of stone rather than in the passing of seasons dwell without their strange ways and alien natures ever being witnessed by the prying eyes of humanity. Even the thought of traveling through the midnight darkness of these great forests causes the boldest of adventurers to stifle a bone-deep shiver that they cannot attribute to any breeze.

Whispers abound around campfires and in drink halls of the terrors caused when one of these dread denizens takes it upon itself to travel outside of its woodland domain but to willingly step through the places that they call home is unthinkable. Out among the looming red oaks and tar-stained pines, there are terrors waiting where men were not meant to tread.

This supplement includes:

3 new creatures snatched from myth and urban legend to add to your campaigns.
The cursed man-turned-fey, the CR 5 bunny man.
The nightmarish Legendary CR 11 not deer.
The wild and bloodthirsty CR 3 white thing.

3 powerful (and very cursed) items that can be harvested from these dread creatures' remains.
The bunny man's axe.
The not deer's antler.
The white thing's pelt.

Plot hooks to tie these creatures into your campaigns.
An introduction to a new creature type, nightmares.

boardgame.name: Cyber Rat Bolt Playset
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb"

'"It started with the banks, if it don't start with an explosion it's always the banks. Everyone lost their money, people panicked, governments tried to step in, but they lost their money too when the financial rug was ripped out from under us. It was the Corporate Biggies who "saved" us. Turns out they got together with each other and planned for something like this, smells fishy to me, but you can't argue with the results. What results, I hear ya ask?

Today the average Cog makes enough money to keep a home over their head, food on the table, and the energy turned on. Even the homeless wanderers can afford to have access to the Net and a few chips in their head, should they want it. Staying alive though, that ain't livin and for those lookin for a bit more excitement in their lives? Well, for that the Corporations began the Rat Bolt.

The Rat Bolt is a race, of a sort, a race to see who survives, who dies, and who becomes famous. The Corporations put out postings, legally sanctioned hits, heists, and black bag jobs for the Ratters (that's us) to take on and run. It's a dog-eat-dog world out there, and you my friend? You just landed yourself smack in the Race. So buckle up, smile at the Ratter-Catcher when they put up the postings and enjoy the ride. It’s Rat Bolt time."

Looking for inspiration on running a Cyber Rat Bolt game? Check out:

Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep, by Philip K. Dick
Cyberpunk 2077, developed by CD Projekt RED
Dredd, directed by Pete Travis
Ghost in the Shell, written by Masamune Shirow

boardgame.name: Primate Troops (QE)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

1947.

Mad scientists! Robots! Talking apes and zombie legions! The World is at their mercy, except for The Lightning League - and you!

In this report the Lightning League takes a look at gorilla minions -because gorillas make everything more fun. Why have a guy with guns walk into a room when you can have two gorilllas with guns walk into a room? This report contains stats and notes for your basic gorilla, the immense version and the Third Reich's bizarre Primate Truppen unit.

Lightning League is an expansion of the Operation White Box system dealing with pulp and dieselpunk adventure and gonzo folly.

Warning, you need Lightning Leaue or Quantum Engine to fully enjoy this game. It is compatible with other 2d6 systems.

boardgame.name: Evil Clowns (QE)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

1947.

There's something funny about this guy!

In this report the Lightning League takes a look at evil clowns. Why have two guys with guns walk into a room when you can have a clown with a banana cream pie? This report contains stats and notes for your evil circus type clowns, the controtionists, slashers and the diminutive Bobbity Doll. Learn all their tricks and be prepared. Remember, comedy is hard but dying is easy.

Lightning League is a version of Stellagama Publishing's Quantum Engine dealing with pulp and dieselpunk adventure and gonzo folly.

Warning, you need Lightning League to fully enjoy this title, though other 2D6 systems can be used with some conversion.

boardgame.name: Serpentines
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Something stirs in the swamps.

Something is killing live stock. People are assaulted.Silently feet pad along alleyways, the death toll rises.

Serpentine! Is he more man or snake? IS he a monster or a pitiful wretch. Is he alone?

Serpentines include rules for introducing snake people in your Lightning League campaign. Rules include portraying the evolution into a deadly threat. Snake people can be customized to surprise your players! This supplement requires the Ligtning League Quantum Edition.

Snake people, a bizarre throwback or the coming race?

boardgame.name: Lightning League
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

1947.

After the War, the good fight continues. Hunt Nazis fugitives, fight renegade scientists, fantastic creatures, and evil despots in a pulp setting!

Mad scientists! Robots! Talking apes! Zombie legions! The World is at their mercy, except for The Lightning League - and you!

This book is a standalone gamebook, using Stellagama Publishing's Quantum Engine. Compatible with most 2d6 systems. It adds options for running pulp style adventures, and dogfight rules. The setting includes NPCs, animals, robots, and factions for a remote and exotic island chain in the South Pacific -the Borroughs Islands.

boardgame.name: Pandemonium Estate
boardgame.description:
Pandemonium Estate is an Otherworldly, Thematic Adventure board game for 2-5 players. Pandemonium Estate takes place in an interdimensional mansion that exists between world and time. The heart of the mansion, the Verge Portal, consumes objects and people from the many worlds it visits, trapping them in the mansion against their will.

Players can choose to play one of three full-length, replayable thematic Storyline modes as one of eight playable characters with their own unique Traits. Regardless of the chosen Storyline, players must complete various tasks in order to gain enough Essence (Victory Points) to return to their home world.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Earth
Erde
Zelená planeta
어스
boardgame.description:
Earth, the soil that supports and sustains our beautiful planet, Earth. Over thousands of years of evolution and adaptation the flora and fauna of this unique planet have grown and developed into amazing life forms, creating symbiotic ecosystems and habitats.

It’s time to jump into these rich environments and create some amazing natural synergies that replicate and extrapolate on Earth’s amazing versatility and plethora of natural resources. Create a self-supporting engine of growth, expansion and supply where even your unused plants become compost for future growth.

Earth is an open world engine builder for 1 to 5 players with simple rules but tons of strategic possibilities. With its encyclopedic nature and the enormous number of unique cards and combinations, every single game will allow you to discover new synergies and connections, just as our vast and fascinating world allows us to do!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Draft Write Records
boardgame.description:
Do you have what it takes to hit the big time? Can you take your band from preforming in your parent's basement to the largest stages around the world?
Draft your lead singer, musicians, production and backstage staff. Arrange them in the most harmonious ways to unlock more fans, money and opportunities. Plan your schedule, prioritize your assets and select your travel routes as you grow.
Chain your rewards into such an amazing show you will leave your competitors behind. But as every superstar knows...watch out for those scandals.

Draft Write Records is a draft and write game for 2-6 players, aged 10+ taking 45 minutes.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Acts: Persecution
boardgame.description: The Persecution expansion simulates some of the challenges faced by the early church. Disciples can have their actions limited, and churches can be destroyed, as the forces of persecution affect region.

boardgame.name: Level Chess
boardgame.description:
Game of chess for 4 with levels.
Level Chess is a chess variant where it's harder to move Up than Down. Then you go Up, you can go just on first reachable box of higher level. Going Down no any restrictions.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Book of Gaub
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A finger trails the letters across a dusty tome.

A finger points the way down a dark haunted alley.

A finger feels for the pulse of life on a long decayed corpse.

A finger scratches the floorboards beneath your feet.

A finger chewed down to a white bone.

A finger that is not there.

A finger catches a shed tear and slides it into a bottle.

These are the Seven Fingers of the Hand of Gaub.

The Book of Gaub is a RPG supplement and anthology of creepy magic and micro-fiction, fit for all game systems and tailored to retro/old school D&D in the style of Wonder & Wickedness. Written by seven authors, their concerted effort fleshes out the Seven Fingers of the Hand of Gaub, manifest through the filigrees of cobwebs and nails, false memories, and nightmares you want to forget.

Aside from its core content - 49 spells and small tales - the Book also includes 100 terrible Catastrophes to invoke when its vile magic goes awry. 20 Monsters are bound in the book as well, together with insidious rituals to turn them to your gain. With some of the 49 bizarre paraphernalia in hand, you may begin your descent to the place where fear lies.

boardgame.name: The Night Hunter
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

The Night Hunter is a cowled figure who lurks among the moonlit hills and brooding pines of the wilds, looking for new victims to flay alive.

When travelers pass through the Night Hunter’s domain, it might
choose them as its new quarry.

boardgame.name: Gate of the Lens Wizards
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

A world unseen lies beyond a twisted, metal gate in a remote field of the Dhalpurna Mountains. Will the characters brave the alien monstrosities, technologies, and magic inside to learn the secrets that have been brooding in this strange place for millennia?

Gate of the Lens Wizard is a science-fantasy exploration adventure for 15th-level characters. It takes about 6-8 hours to complete and includes:


A gate that leads to the tunnels beneath a distant jungle moon
Intelligent spiders at war with glass-skulled astronomy wizards
An unfathomable artifact that can rewrite time itself
Combat cards for each monster, PC, and special treasure

boardgame.name: Monastery of the Shadow Sorcerers
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Beneath the blood moon, a dark monastery appears for one night atop a high plateau. Inside its walls, the mighty black lotus flower reaches its full bloom. Can the characters steal inside the monastery, defeat its sorcerous guardians, and claim the blossom before the sun rises?

Monastery of the Shadow Sorcerers is a fiendish sword-and-sorcery adventure for 8th-level characters. It takes about 4-6 hours to complete and includes:


An extra-planar monastery brooding beneath the blood moon
Sorcerer-monks who move like smoke and strike with fire and blade
Combat cards for each monster, PC, and special treasure

boardgame.name: Fangs of Oatali
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

An artifact belonging to an ancient couatl god has been stolen from his shrine. Can the characters recover the Fangs of Oatali before the god's wrath unleashes a devastating cataclysm upon the jungle?

Fangs of Oatali is a pulp-action adventure set in the jungle for 6th-level characters. It takes about 4-6 hours to complete and includes:


Stealthy raids, hidden enemies, and the clash of two primal gods
Angry pterodactyls, massive sinkholes, and earth-quaking magic
Combat cards for each monster, PC, and special treasure

boardgame.name: Night on Devil's Peak
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

On the night of the rare Witch Moon, a binding spell placed over the mighty devil Tchernabog finally breaks. Will the characters be able to survive the night of boiling hellfire, furious undead, and diabolical mayhem Tchernabog orchestrates from atop Devil's Peak?

Night on Devil's Peak is an apocalyptic, events-based survival adventure for 6th-level characters. It takes about 5-6 hours to complete and includes:


The awakening of a CR 24 devil, mighty Tchernabog!
A powerful holy relic the characters can wield in battle
Two diabolical new monsters: Tchernabog and giant flaming skeletons
Combat cards for each monster, PC, and special treasure

boardgame.name: The Demon in the Mirror
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

The Iron King's daughter has been cursed by a demon who lurks inside a mirror locked deep in the palace dungeons. Can the characters win their freedom from those same dungeons by entering the mirror demon's horrifying, maze-like realm and finding a way to end the curse?

The Demon in the Mirror is a creepy dungeon crawl adventure for 5th-level characters. It takes about 5-7 hours to complete and includes:


An otherworldly, reality-bending realm inside a magical mirror
Four new monsters: the mirror demon, ceiling creep, reflection demon, and librarian of Leng!
Combat cards for each monster, PC, and special treasure

boardgame.name: Ghostlight
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

A mysterious ship emerges from the dark ocean mist, its lantern-lit deck silent and empty. When invisible hands cast lines and ropes over to the characters, will they accept the invitation to board and enter the secret afterlife of departed sailors?

Ghostlight is a nautical sword-and-sorcery adventure for 1st-level characters. It takes about 4-6 hours to complete and includes:


A haunting foray into the afterlife for good and evil sailors
A mad witch, a dashing rat pirate, and a tavern full of departed souls
Combat cards for each monster, PC, and special treasure

boardgame.name: Lords of Ragnarok: Utgard – Realms of the Giants
boardgame.description:
Utgard is a land that was sometimes recognized as the world and sometimes only as a fortress located in Jotunheim. Regardless, it was a place inhabited by Ice Giants. In the game, Utgard will replace Jotunheim. With this realm, you will introduce Ice Giants to the game, which players with an alliance will be able to recruit into their armies. They will be helpful in the next battle in which your army will take part, giving you a significant bonus to strength.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Special Weapon Tiles
boardgame.description:
Part of an add-on (Treasure Chest Promos) during the Robinson Crusoe Collector's edition Gamefound campaign.

Special weapon tiles introduce additional usage of your weapons when you hunt for certain animals.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Collector's Edition (Gamefound Edition)

boardgame.name: Terminus
boardgame.description:
You and your competitors’ transit companies have been hired by the city to build new subway lines and commercial developments to improve the city's bottom line.
Manage assets such as time, money, & resources to build your subway line. Gain prestige by completing objectives and fulfilling the city’s transit demands. Focus on individual projects, open Agendas or a little of both in an effort to earn more prestige than the competition. Can you stay on track to deliver on the cities many needs?

Terminus is a subway planning, developing and construction game for 2-5 players, aged 14+, taking 30-40 minutes per player.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Aqualin: GeekUp Bag
boardgame.description: A single 21cm x 22cm microfiber bag for use with Aqualin. Featuring new artwork from the Sophie Rekasowski (the game's artist), this bag can be used as both a storage bag and drawbag for the tiles in the game, and still fits within the game box with the insert
